title: Customer Experience Specialist
description:
Job description:



We are hiring remote Engagement Specialists who are customers of the brands we work with. You will help place simple engagements on Reddit using content we provide. If you have one or more Reddit accounts that meet the requirements below, you can start earning this week.



What You Will Do:



Use the example posts or comments we give you

Copy and paste those posts or comments into specific Reddit threads

Follow clear, step by step placement instructions

Use your own Reddit account or accounts

Minimum Reddit Account Requirements:



Each account must:



Be at least 30 days old

Have 100 or more total karma

Have at least 25 contributions

If your account does not meet these requirements yet, you can build it up fairly quickly. You may register multiple qualifying accounts.



This Role Is Ideal For:



Regular Reddit users who want simple, flexible work

People with multiple Reddit accounts

Anyone looking for remote income they can do on their own schedule

title: Outbound Sales Representative
description:
About the Role:



We are seeking a confident and professional Outbound Sales Representative to speak directly with healthcare businesses and convert interest into clients. This role focuses on phone-based sales conversations, follow-ups, and closing initial commitments.



This position is ideal for someone who is:



• Comfortable on the phone

• Confident speaking with business owners and administrators in english.

• Skilled at explaining value and handling objections



Key Responsibilities:



• Make outbound calls to:

        • Home health agencies

        • Clinics

        • Medical offices

• Follow up on warm leads and prior outreach

• Clearly explain our virtual assistant services

• Handle objections professionally

• Encourage prospects to move forward with a trial or onboarding

• Keep detailed call notes in Google Sheets

• Re-contact leads multiple times when needed

• Identify common objections and feedback trends

• Work closely with the lead generation team

• Tools & Software You Should Be Comfortable With:

        • Google Sheets

        • 
 (team communication)

        •
 (Gmail)

        • Web-based time tracking tools (e.g., WebWork will be supplied)



Required Skills & Qualifications:



• Clear spoken English with minimal accent

• Strong phone presence and confidence

• Sales or telemarketing experience

• Comfortable handling rejection

• Professional, calm, and persuasive communication style

• Ability to follow scripts while sounding natural

• Reliable internet and quiet calling environment



Preferred (Nice to Have):



• Healthcare sales or medical office experience

• Experience selling services (not physical products)

• Follow-up–driven mindset



Performance Expectations:



• Consistent daily call volume

• Strong follow-up discipline

• Accurate documentation of conversations

• Conversion of interested leads into clients



Shared Expectations for Both Roles:

• Full-time availability during Los Angeles, CA USA business hours

• Daily communication via 

• Reliable attendance and punctuality

• Willingness to learn and improve

• Long-term mindset (not a short-term gig)



How to apply:

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



In this role, you won't just manage a calendar; you’ll be an integral part of a team growing Korean brands. We are looking for a proactive professional who treats the CEO’s goals as their own. This is a long-term, full-time commitment for someone who wants to move beyond administrative support and become an integral part of a fast-growing, international organization.



Key Responsibilities:



- Manage and optimize the CEO’s schedule, meetings, and calendar prioritizing engagements across multiple time zones (KR, SG, PH, MY).

- Coordinate domestic, international travel, including visas, multi-city itineraries, and ground logistics for regional brand events.

- Handle confidential information with absolute discretion.

- Prepare reports, presentations, and executive correspondence.

- Serve as a primary point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

- Coordinate board meetings, leadership meetings, and follow-ups.

- Track action items and ensure timely execution of priorities.

- Support strategic initiatives and special projects as assigned.

- Manage expenses, reimbursements, and basic administrative reporting.

- Other adhoc tasks as assigned.



Qualifications:



- 2-5 years of experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or similar role.

- Experience supporting leadership within a Singaporean, Korean or multi-cultural corporate environment.

- Familiar with Korean Top Brands and international retail industries.

- Proficient with International Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok, and Big Seller.

- Advance proficiency in Google Workspace, Canva and project management software.

- Exceptional organizational, time-management, and multitasking skills.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: CAD technician
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant CAD Technician whose primary role is to produce high-quality technical drawings. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Revit and Bluebeam Revu and have reliable access to both software applications. This position is focused exclusively on drawing production, without any responsibilities for project coordination, as our team will handle all coordination tasks.



Key Responsibilities:

• Drawing Production:

  - Develop, update, and refine technical drawings and design documents using Revit and Bluebeam Revu.

  - Ensure that all drawings are accurate, clear, and compliant with project specifications.

  - Convert sketches or preliminary designs into precise digital drawings as required.



• Quality Assurance:

  - Review drawing details for consistency and accuracy before submission.

  - Make revisions based on internal feedback and adhere to quality standards.



• Software Proficiency:

  - Utilize Revit for creating and modifying detailed architectural or engineering drawings.

  - Use Bluebeam Revu to annotate, review, and manage digital drawing workflows.



• Documentation:

  - Maintain organized digital files of all drawings with accurate version control.

  - Implement standard operating procedures for file management and archiving.



Qualifications:

• Proven proficiency in Revit and Bluebeam Revu with access to the latest versions.

• Demonstrated experience in producing technical drawings in a fast-paced environment.

• Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and clarity in all documentation.

• Ability to work independently and manage workload without involvement in project coordination.

• Effective communication skills for clarifying drawing instructions and feedback.



What We Offer:

• A fully remote, flexible work environment focused exclusively on drawing production.

• Opportunities for professional development in advanced CAD techniques and software utilization.

• A clear, focused role that allows you to concentrate on producing high-quality technical drawings without additional coordination responsibilities.



This role is a great fit for a technician who excels in drawing production and is looking to work with industry-standard tools like Revit and Bluebeam Revu. If you are passionate about precision and quality in technical drawings, we encourage you to apply.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
We’re looking for a creative, detail-oriented Graphic Designer with a strong design philosophy to join LeverBrands.



In this role, you’ll work with up to 5 to 6 clients as part of a pod, creating high-quality, eye-catching social media visuals that align with each client’s brand identity.





You’ll primarily design LinkedIn and Instagram content, including carousels, infographics, and visual assets that help our clients stand out and grow their personal brands.







Your Responsibilities



- Design Social Media Content

- Design high-quality visuals for LinkedIn, including carousels, infographics, and quote graphics.

- Maintain strong visual consistency across multiple client accounts while adapting to each client’s unique brand identity.

- Apply a clear design philosophy rather than designing randomly.

- Stay up to date with design and social media trends to keep content modern and relevant.







Collaborate With the Team



- Work closely with brand managers and content writers to turn ideas into strong visual content.

- Follow brand guidelines and feedback precisely.

- Manage your workload across multiple clients without compromising quality.



---



Key Skills & Requirements



???? Figma Is Mandatory





- Strong proficiency in Figma is REQUIRED.

- All client designs are created, managed, and delivered in Figma.

- We will not consider applicants who do not have practical, working knowledge of Figma.





Other Requirements



- Experience with Photoshop and Illustrator is a plus (but secondary to Figma).

- Strong visual design skills with a good eye for layout, spacing, typography, and hierarchy.

- Ability to maintain design consistency across multiple brands.

- High attention to detail, no sloppy designs.

- Reliable, proactive, and able to meet deadlines without being chased.

- Positive attitude and openness to feedback.





Why You’ll Love Working at LeverBrands



- Work with a team that genuinely enjoys what they do.

- A supportive environment where creativity is encouraged.

- Freedom to bring ideas to life and make a real impact.

- Your work directly affects entrepreneurs, founders, and CEOs.

- We invest in your growth through feedback, mentorship, and opportunity.

 Address

title: TikTok Ad Creator - Virtual Assistant (Full-Time)
description:
About the Role



We run a fast-paced digital advertising company that creates TikTok video ads daily. We're looking for a dedicated VA to produce 20+ simple video ads per day using our proven system and AI tools.



This is NOT complex video editing. The work involves taking short TikTok clips, running them through our AI tools to generate captions, and adding text overlays using TikTok's built-in video editor. If you can follow a clear process and have a feel for what sounds natural on TikTok, this role is for you.



What You'll Do



- Source viral TikTok clips that match our ad style

- Use our AI tools (Gemini + Claude) to analyze clips and generate caption options

- Select the best caption and add it as a text overlay in TikTok's video editor

- Submit finished ads for review (expect feedback and revisions early on)

- Produce 20+ ads per day once fully trained



Requirements



- You actively use TikTok and understand the culture/language on the platform

- You can read and write casual English fluently (slang, informal speech)

- iPhone (required - our workflow does not support Android)

- Reliable internet connection

- Available to work full-time (40 hrs/week, flexible schedule)

- Comfortable using AI tools (we'll train you on the specific ones)

- Fast learner who can follow SOPs and take feedback well



Nice to Have



- Experience with social media content creation

- Familiarity with CapCut or TikTok's video editor

- Understanding of what makes content go viral on TikTok



Compensation

$5/h + performance bonuses



How to Apply



Send us:

1. A brief intro about yourself

2. Your experience with TikTok and social media content (if any)

3. Why you think you'd be a good fit for this role

4. Your phone model (e.g. iPhone 13, iPhone 15 Pro)







We'll respond to strong applications within 48 hours.

title: Remote Part-Time MS 365 Administrator (50%, Freelancer)
description:
Hello,



We are looking for a reliable and detail-oriented **Microsoft 365 Administrator** to support our day-to-day IT operations on a **remote, part-time basis (approx. 20 hours per week)**.



This role focuses on **standard Microsoft 365 and Intune administration**, not advanced architecture or security design.



---



### ???? Role Overview



* Position: Microsoft 365 Administrator (Freelance)

* Work type: Remote

* Time commitment: ~50% (around 20 hours/week)

* Contract type: Freelancer

* Compensation: **USD 300 per month**

* Start: As soon as possible

* Long-term cooperation preferred



---



### ???? Responsibilities



**Microsoft 365 / Entra ID**



* Create, update, and disable user accounts

* Assign and manage Microsoft 365 licenses

* Manage groups (security & Microsoft 365 groups)

* Basic role assignments (User Admin, License Admin, etc.)

* Support onboarding and offboarding processes



**Intune (Endpoint Management)**



* Enroll and remove devices (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android)

* Assign configuration and compliance policies

* Deploy standard applications

* Manage device groups

* Basic Intune troubleshooting (policies not applying, enrollment issues)

* Assist users with device-related issues



**Azure (Basic)**



* Basic Azure AD / Entra ID administration

* Subscription overview and access management (RBAC – limited scope)

* Cost awareness and reporting support (no architecture changes)



**General IT Support**



* Follow documented SOPs and checklists

* Keep changes documented

* Communicate clearly about completed tasks and issues

* Escalate complex or security-related topics



---



### ???? Access & Security Model



* No permanent Global Admin access

* Role-based access only (via PIM)

* Separate admin account required

* MFA mandatory

* Work strictly within defined procedures



---



### ? Requirements



* 3+ years experience with Microsoft 365 administration

* Hands-on experience with Intune device management

* Good understanding of Entra ID (Azure AD)

* Reliable internet connection

* Good written English

* High level of trustworthiness and attention to detail



**Nice to have**



* Experience supporting remote users

* Basic IT documentation experience

* Familiarity with SOP-based work



---



### ???? Not Required



* No scripting or automation



---



### ???? What We Offer



* Stable, long-term freelance cooperation

* Clear tasks and responsibilities

* Low-pressure environment

* Respectful communication

* On-time monthly payment



---



If you are interested, please reply with:



* A short summary of your Microsoft 365 and Intune experience

* Your availability (hours per week)

* Your preferred communication times



We look forward to working with you.



Best regards,

IT4EX TEAM

title: Guest Post Assistant
description:
Guest Post Assistant Job Description



Full-Time | Remote (Philippines) | UK Timezone



Location: United Kingdom (Remote)



Hours: 40 hours/week



Salary: $600/month (fixed)



(Full-Time, Remote – Philippines)



Work Hours

- UK timezone

- Full-time, 40 hours/week



---



About the Role



We manage multiple websites and receive daily guest post and backlink inquiries. We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Guest Post Assistant to take full ownership of our guest posting operations.



This role is for someone who understands that guest posting is a business process, not just replying to
s.



You’ll manage multiple website inboxes and guest post requests, ensuring every inquiry is handled professionally, efficiently, and consistently.



This is NOT a basic admin role. You’ll be responsible for handling negotiations, confirming orders, coordinating post uploads, and managing the full guest post workflow from inquiry to publication.



This role is ideal for someone who:



- Can manage high-volume
 inquiries without missing details

- Is comfortable with pricing discussions and objections

- Is organised, structured, and process-driven

- Communicates professionally with external clients

- Can manage multiple websites and workflows at once

- Takes ownership of the entire guest post process



You’ll be trusted to manage daily operations and ensure guest post orders are handled smoothly end-to-end.



---



 **Key Responsibilities**



 **Guest Post Management (Multi-Website)**



- Monitor
 inbox daily for guest post inquiries

- Respond to clients requesting to publish guest posts on our websites

- Negotiate pricing with clients:

    - Handle objections professionally

    - Manage negotiations when clients request lower pricing

- Accept orders by confirming fees and terms with clients

- Post approved content to the correct website accounts

- Send confirmation
s to clients with the published links

- Create and send invoices to clients.

- Manage guest posting service across multiple websites



---

 **Workflow, Accuracy & Performance**



- Ensure inquiries are handled **promptly and professionally**

- Track orders and publication status accurately

- Maintain organised records of inquiries, orders, and live links

- Identify bottlenecks or issues in the guest post workflow

- Suggest improvements to streamline processes



---



 **Ownership & Execution**



- Manage multiple guest post requests without dropping details

- Work independently and take responsibility for daily inbox management

- Flag issues early and escalate when needed

- Keep communication clear, professional, and consistent

- Maintain accuracy when handling pricing, orders, and posting



---



 **Required Skills**



- Fluent in English, with strong written communication skills

- Professional
 communication with external clients

- Highly organised and detail-oriented

- Comfortable handling negotiations and objections

- Reliable with daily inbox monitoring

- Able to manage multiple website accounts



---



 **Tools You Should Be Comfortable Using**



-
 (Gmail or similar)

- Basic CMS posting (WordPress or similar)

- PayPal invoicing

- Google Workspace

- Notion or basic task tracking tools



---



 **Bonus (Not Required)**



- Experience with guest posting or link-building workflows

- Experience managing multiple websites

- Basic understanding of SEO or content publishing



---



**Requirements**



- 1-2 years experience as virtual assistant

- Reliable laptop (minimum **8GB RAM**)

- Stable, fast internet connection

- Ability to work UK hours



---



 **How to Apply**



 **Include the following in your
:**



- A short introduction (Any relevant experience with
 handling or guest posting)

===================================================================================================

Full-Time | Long-Term | Remote)

Compensation: $4.65 per hour / approx. $900 per month

Overtime: Required on some days (paid separately)



About the Company

We own and operate a UK-based advertising and marketing firm serving business clients. Our environment is structured, fast-paced, and performance-driven. We value organisation, accountability, and people who take ownership of their responsibilities.

This role works closely with management to ensure operations run smoothly, tasks are tracked, and nothing falls through the cracks.



Role Overview

We are hiring a highly organised Operations Coordinator to support management and internal operations. This role focuses on coordination, tracking, follow-ups, reporting, and process support, rather than classic executive PA work.

This is not an entry-level role and not suitable for casual applicants. We are looking for someone structured, dependable, and able to manage multiple moving parts calmly.



====================================================================================================



Key Responsibilities

Coordinate daily operational tasks and internal workflows

Track tasks, deadlines, and deliverables across teams

Follow up with staff to ensure work is completed on time

Prepare internal reports, summaries, and status updates for management

Support scheduling, coordination, and internal communications

title: Finance Administrator
description:
Accounts Receivable and Payable Management

Process and manage all client invoices in Xero, ensuring accuracy and timely invoicing.

Monitor accounts receivable, following up on overdue accounts and maintaining updated client payment records.

Reconcile accounts payable, processing payments and maintaining accurate financial records for client accounts.



Bank Reconciliation and Cash Flow Management

Perform monthly bank reconciliations for all client accounts in Xero, ensuring accurate records and identifying discrepancies.

Monitor client cash flow and provide updates to the Financial Manager, ensuring all transactions are recorded accurately.

Work with franchisees and SLA clients to address reconciliation issues, supporting clarity and accuracy in cash flow management.



Financial Reporting and Compliance

Prepare monthly financial reports for clients, including Profit & Loss statements, Balance Sheets, and Cash Flow summaries.

Provide detailed financial reports to the Financial Manager and ensure that reports are compliant with industry standards.

Ensure all records meet compliance requirements, maintaining accurate documentation for audits and regulatory reviews.



Client Liaison and Relationship Management

Act as the main point of contact for external clients, addressing questions regarding financial transactions and processes.

Conduct regular financial reviews with clients, discussing financial performance, answering queries, and advising on best practices.

Build and maintain strong client relationships, ensuring a high level of service and financial support.



Process Improvement and Efficiency Optimization

Identify opportunities to streamline bookkeeping processes, suggesting improvements to enhance workflow in Xero.

Collaborate with the Financial Manager to implement process changes that support efficient, accurate financial management.



Data Entry and Record Keeping

Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records in Xero, ensuring proper documentation of all transactions.

Organize and manage client records for easy access and retrieval, supporting transparency and accountability.



Compliance and Tax Preparation Support

Ensure compliance with tax regulations and prepare documentation required for tax filings.

Work closely with the Financial Manager and external accountants to provide necessary information for tax preparation.



Expense Tracking and Budgeting Assistance

Track client expenses, helping franchisees and SLA clients adhere to budget limits.

Prepare budget variance reports and advise clients on expense management best practices.



Self-Management and Professional Development

Manage time effectively to meet deadlines, balancing multiple client accounts and prioritizing tasks.

Participate in professional development opportunities to stay updated on bookkeeping practices, Xero updates, and financial regulations.

title: Real Estate Transaction Manager/ Virtual Assistant
description:
PLEASE READ FULL DESCRIPTION AND FOLLOW APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS FOR CONSIDERATION



ABOUT US:

We are currently seeking 1-2 motivated Listing Manager/ Transaction Coordinator/Executive Assistant professionals as a dedicated hi-level support staff  for our Real Estate Team.  



JOB OVERVIEW:

This position requires an experienced and highly skilled candidate who will primarily focus on supporting the real estate transaction process, ensuring smooth and timely closings. Previous Listing coordinator and MLS experience and in depth knowledge of the contract to close process is required.  Experience with eXp Systems is a plus. You’ll also provide general administrative support. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is detail-oriented, highly organized, and looking to grow in the real estate industry.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Transaction Management: Oversee and support the full real estate transaction process from contract to closing, including coordinating timelines, documents, and communication between agents, clients, and other parties.

- MLS Listings: Create and manage property listings on Multiple Listing Services (experience with OneKey/HGAR MLS is a plus)

- Property Descriptions: Write compelling and accurate property descriptions to showcase listings.

- Administrative Support: Assist the with tasks such as managing
 inquiries, organizing documents, and scheduling appointments.

- Social Media & Content Creation: Post and create content for listings  on social media platforms.

- Client and Partner Outreach: Manage outbound calls, texts and
s to agents, attorneys, lenders and clients to assist in deal follow ups and transaction management



LOOKING FOR:

- Minimum 1 year of real estate experience, preferably with eXp Realty systems like SkySlope.

- Previous direct support of top producing listing agents managing listings from start to finish.

- In depth understanding of the Real Estate transaction contract to close process

- Experience with managing and responding to communications on behalf of CEO

- Ability to manage 20+ transactions at once and keep track of changing status and priorities. 

- Strong proficiency with Google Drive, MLS, CRM, Canva and eXp tools.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

- Highly organized, quick thinking and able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously.

- A positive, team-oriented attitude with a strong desire to grow and succeed in the real estate industry.



APPLICATION (MUST BE FOLLOWED IN DETAIL OR APPLICATION WILL NOT BE REVIEWED):

 
 The Following:

title: Customer Operations Agent - Management Exp is a Plus!
description:
If you’re a Customer Operations Agent leader in fintech/lending and want to join a startup with major career growth opportunities, this role is for you!

Apply Here: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagYg48MNpIqaV148/form



As a Customer Operations Agent, you’ll be the friendly, trusted face of our brand—supporting customers with empathy and clarity whether they’re managing payments, reporting fraud, or simply need guidance. You’ll be a founding member of the Customer Service team and will play an increasingly important role as it grows.



This role is ideal for someone who started their career as a customer service agent and progressed into a leadership or management position, gaining hands-on experience while helping teams scale. Experience working with or within major financial institutions or fintechs such as Wells Fargo, JP Morgan, Starling Bank, or similar organizations is highly valued. We’re looking for someone who can bring both frontline expertise and leadership mindset to help shape our customer operations from the ground up.



IMPORTANT: Please carefully read the responsibilities below to ensure you're a good fit, and follow the instructions on how to apply at the bottom.



Compensation:

* Competitive salary: $1,200 – $1,400 USD per month (depending on experience)

* Opportunity to grow into a Team Lead/Manager position (with a raise) as the support team expands



Benefits:

* 100% Remote - work from anywhere in the Philippines.

* 15 days paid leave

* Bi-weekly salary payouts

* Paid time off and Philippine public holiday, listed here

* Supportive, startup-style culture where your ideas matter

* Clear growth path and strong learning opportunities in fintech



Working Hours:

* Monday, Tuesday, Friday: 12 PM – 9 PM UK time (8 PM – 5 AM PH time)

* Saturday, Sunday: 11 AM – 8 PM UK time (7 PM – 4 AM PH time)

* Wednesday & Thursday rest days

* This is a full time role only (40 hours per week)



Core Responsibilities

* Deliver exceptional multi-channel support (chat,
, and phone) with a focus on first-contact resolution and high customer satisfaction.

* Uphold brand standards by communicating clearly, consistently, and professionally in all interactions.

* Actively manage brand reputation by professionally responding to all customer reviews and public feedback.

* Handle and resolve customer complaints with empathy and efficiency, knowing when and how to appropriately escalate complex issues.

* Oversee customer repayments and collections by assisting with payment management, rescheduling, and account oversight with professionalism and care.

* Protect the business by proactively identifying, investigating, and escalating suspicious activity and potential fraud cases.

* Leverage AI-driven tools to streamline workflows, optimize response times, and enhance the quality of support delivered.

* Drive continuous improvement by gathering and sharing actionable customer insights with product and internal teams to enhance offerings and processes.



You’re Perfect for This Role If You

* Have proven experience in customer service, ideally within fintech, payments, or * lending (BNPL experience a plus).

* Understand fraud detection, repayments, and collections, with empathy for customers’ financial situations.

* Communicate effectively across chat,
, and phone, adapting tone and approach to each channel.

* Are tech-savvy and comfortable using AI tools and automation to streamline work.

* Thrive in a fast-paced, customer-first startup environment where priorities shift quickly.

* Are an empathetic problem solver with strong attention to detail, professionalism, and integrity.



How to Apply:

* Click the link below to submit your application and let's get started: 
/appqyBZJyyxs1htVk/pagYg48MNpIqaV148/form

title: YouTube Video Editor (Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): 

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: Operations & Driver Performance Analyst (Remote)
description:
This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with data, identifying performance trends, and creating clear daily reporting that helps operations run more efficiently.



We are hiring an Operations & Driver Performance Analyst to support our Delivery Service Partner (DSP) delivery operation by collecting, organizing, and analyzing operational data to provide clear visibility into driver performance and operational trends.



This role exists to remove data collection, reporting, and coaching preparation responsibilities from dispatch so dispatch can focus on daily operational execution. The role focuses on reviewing prior-day performance data, initiating standardized follow-up coaching communication, and maintaining accurate performance tracking so dispatch can remain focused on real-time operations.



Reporting produced in this role is used directly by leadership to guide staffing, coaching, and performance decisions. The goal is to make operational decisions clear and data-driven rather than reactive.



This is a data-driven role focused on reporting, analysis, and operational follow-through — not dispatch or disciplinary decision-making.



Key Responsibilities



Performance Reporting & Analysis

• Collect and maintain daily driver performance data including safety, quality, attendance, pace, rescues, and Delivery Completion Rate (DCR) metrics

• Build and maintain daily and weekly performance reports

• Clearly identify top performers, stable performers, and drivers requiring attention

• Identify trends and recurring performance patterns across the driver group

• Maintain driver performance records and reporting documentation

• Present data in a clear format that allows leadership to make staffing and coaching decisions quickly



Coaching Communication & Follow-Up

• Review daily performance metrics and initiate follow-up coaching communications with drivers using existing LMDmax message templates based on defined performance thresholds

• Send coaching
s or messages related to attendance points, safety events, or quality defects using established templates

• Follow up with drivers to ensure required safety or quality quizzes are completed when applicable

• Track coaching activity and quiz completion for reporting purposes



Compliance & Data Verification

• Verify completion of required safety and quality quizzes prior to routes

• Identify discrepancies or errors in operational data

• Submit and track dispute tickets through the DSP portal when corrections are required

• Maintain documentation and follow issues through to resolution



Requirements

• Experience with data analysis, reporting, or operational performance tracking

• Strong Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel skills

• High attention to detail and consistency

• Strong written and spoken English communication

• Comfortable communicating professionally with drivers using structured templates

• Able to work independently and organize information clearly



Tools & Systems Used

• LMDmax platform for template-based driver coaching communication

• Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel for performance tracking and reporting

• Attendance point tracking system and coaching templates

• DSP portal for dispute tracking and issue resolution



Important Notes

• This is a full-time, long-term role performed remotely

• Paid hourly as an independent contractor (not an employee)

• Work must be performed personally (no subcontracting)

• Single-client role only

• This role provides reporting and operational support; leadership retains final decision-making authority

title: Video Editor and Graphic Designer
description:
About Socialwire



Socialwire helps asset managers, funds, and financial institutions build their digital brand. We operate at the intersection of finance, technology, and communications, delivering clean, compliant, and professional digital content for a highly discerning audience.



Role Overview



We are seeking a talented Video Editor & Graphic Designer to support the creation of high-quality visual content across video, digital, and social channels. This role is ideal for a creative professional who understands corporate branding, financial services aesthetics, and the importance of clarity, consistency, and credibility in visual communication.



You will work closely with marketing, content, and client teams to produce visuals that reflect the professionalism and trust required in the asset management industry.



Key Responsibilities:



Video Editing

- Edit short- and long-form video content for digital platforms, websites, and social media

- Create polished, on-brand videos including interviews, executive commentary, explainers, and promotional content

- Apply clean motion graphics, lower thirds, titles, and transitions consistent with corporate branding

- Optimize video formats for various platforms (LinkedIn, web, presentations, etc.)

- Ensure all video content meets quality, brand, and compliance standards



Graphic Design

- Design digital assets including social media graphics, presentations, marketing materials, and brand visuals

- Maintain a consistent visual identity across all assets, aligned with Socialwire’s brand guidelines

- Develop templates and reusable design systems for efficiency and scalability

- Collaborate with internal teams to translate concepts into clear, professional visuals



Brand & Quality Standards

- Maintain a clean, corporate, and professional visual style at all times

- Ensure accuracy, clarity, and consistency in all content, especially for financial audiences

- Adapt designs to suit asset managers, funds, and institutional clients



Requirements:

- 3+ years of experience in video editing and graphic design

- Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Canva, Captcut, PowerPoint or equivalent tools

- Experience creating content for corporate, financial, or B2B audiences

- Strong understanding of typography, layout, and visual hierarchy

- Excellent attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines



Nice to Have

- Experience working with financial services, asset management, or investor communications

- Motion graphics or animation experience

- Familiarity with brand compliance or regulated industries

- Basic understanding of social media best practices for professional platforms (especially LinkedIn)

title: Credit Repair Dispute Manager (Full Process Handling)
description:
We are a U.S.-based credit consulting company seeking an experienced Credit Repair Dispute Specialist to manage the dispute process from start to finish.



The ideal candidate has prior hands-on experience reviewing credit reports, determining dispute strategies, and preparing personalized disputes and complaints in compliance with credit reporting standards.



Responsibilities:

 • Review client credit reports and identify inaccuracies

 • Determine appropriate dispute reasons and strategy

 • Prepare personalized dispute letters (no template-only disputes)

 • Handle bureau disputes and follow-up rounds

 • Prepare CFPB and FTC complaints when necessary

 • Track dispute timelines and maintain organized client records

 • Update dispute status within Credit Repair Cloud or similar system



Requirements:

 • Minimum 2 years experience in credit repair or dispute processing

 • Strong understanding of dispute workflows and credit reporting

 • Experience creating customized dispute letters

 • Strong written English skills

 • Ability to work independently and manage multiple clients



This role manages the dispute process while the company owner handles client consultations and onboarding.



This is a growing business currently expanding its client base. During the initial phase (first 30 active clients), compensation will be $180 USD per month while workload is part-time.



As the client base and company revenue grow, compensation and hours will increase accordingly. This is intended to become a long-term role with growth opportunity.

title: Accounts Recovery Assistant
description:
Employment Type: Part-time (Remote)

Location: Remote (Aligning to Australia AEDT hours)

Hours: 20 hours a week (Between 8 am and 4 pm, Monday to Friday)

Reports to: Head of Operations and Coaching

About SHE-com

SHE-com is the world’s fastest growing community for female e-commerce brand owners. We are on a mission to empower women to launch, grow, and scale their online brands with confidence, clarity, and a lot of fun along the way. We simplify the complexities of online business with practical strategies, expert coaching, and a vibrant, supportive community.

About the Role

We are looking for a proactive and friendly Accounts Recovery Specialist to join our team and support our community by helping members navigate failed payment issues. You will play a key role in maintaining positive relationships, supporting members through their payment challenges, and ensuring they continue to thrive in our programs. You will work closely under the guidance of our Product Lead to align with SHE-com’s goals and strategies.

As an Accounts Recovery Specialist, you will:

 • Monitor and manage all failed payments within the first 30 days, using HubSpot to stay on top of every detail

 • Make regular outbound phone calls to members to help them resolve payment issues quickly and positively

 • Handle difficult conversations with empathy and professionalism, balancing kindness with firmness to reach positive outcomes

 • Guide clients through payment problem-solving with compassion and confidence

 • Accurately document all call outcomes and next steps in HubSpot

 • Escalate any genuine hardship cases to your manager as per our process

 • Collaborate with our programs teams to ensure seamless transitions and member support

 • Track and report on key performance indicators like recovery rates, call volumes, and resolution times

 • Offer suggestions and feedback to improve the payment recovery process

 • Participate in ongoing training to stay up to date with best practices and SHE-com’s approach

About You

 • Passionate about supporting women in business and genuinely care about their success

 • Confident and warm on the phone, with experience handling high call volumes

 • Skilled at having hard conversations with empathy, understanding, and firmness, always aiming for a positive outcome

 • Organised and detail-oriented, with strong problem-solving skills

 • Comfortable using HubSpot CRM (training provided)

 • Analytical, able to review account histories and recommend solutions

 • Skilled at creating positive outcomes for both clients and the business

 • Adaptable and open to new technologies and process improvements

 • Experienced in phone-based customer service, credit control, or accounts

 • Familiar with subscription-based business models (preferred)

Why Join Us

 • Be part of an inspiring team of women who are passionate about changing lives

 • Work in a flexible, remote-first environment with a schedule that fits your lifestyle

 • Access to SHE-com’s programs and resources for your own growth

 • Make a meaningful impact in the lives of hundreds of women entrepreneurs

How to Apply:



Submit Your Resume: Highlighting relevant experience.

Video Cover Letter (1-2 minutes):

- Why are you applying for this role at SHE-com?

- What about the company or position excites you?

- Why are you a great fit for this role?



 us your video and resume to 
 with the subject line: “Your New Accounts Recovery VA!”

title: AMAZON OPERATION/ACCOUNT MANAGER
description:
AMAZON OPERATION MANAGER



Position: Amazon Operations Manager / Amazon Expert

Type: Full-Time, Hybrid (Philippines)

Salary: ?45,000 – ?75,000 / month

Schedule: Flexible Hybrid daytime PH hours



About our Company



We are a Canadian corporation specialized in international trade and e-commerce. We are operating in the global market, and we want to utilize global ecommerce platforms such as Amazon to develop new brands and products and reach out to customers across globe. Our company values professionalism, data-driven decision-making, and long-term partnerships. We are establishing a strong, world-class team in the Philippines.

We're seeking an Amazon Operation Manager who will implement effective growth strategies, help managing day-to-day operations, hiring staff and ensure optimal ROAS (Return on Ad Spend) and profitability.

Role Summary

As the Amazon Operation Manager, you will oversee one or more Amazon seller/vendor accounts, be responsible for strategic planning, day-to-day operations, campaign management, listing optimization, inventory & health monitoring, performance reporting and delivering growth targets. You’ll assist in hiring a Manila based team (PPC specialists, graphic designers, copy/content, operations, data analysts) as contractors or part-time staff.



Key Responsibilities



- Own the Amazon account(s): day-to-day operations, growth roadmap, strategic planning.

- Develop and execute account growth strategy: new product launches, listing optimization (titles, bullets, A+ content), SEO/organic traffic, sponsored ads (Sponsored Products/Brands/Display), DSP where applicable.

- Assist in hiring new team members in coordination with the owners: you will be the point of contact for the company for the Manila team and will assist in hiring part-time or full-time staff/contractors, freelancers to complete the tasks based on demand.

- Manage other team members and monitor KPIs: manage and monitor other team members and coordinate their efforts to achieve the desired outcomes. creative team for imagery/video, buyer for product research, procurement, and inventory planning, PPC specialist for running and optimizing variety of ads campaigns.

- Plan, run, and optimize PPC campaigns in coordination with the PPC specialist: structure, keyword research, match types, negative keyword strategy, bid optimization, budget allocation, ROI/ROAS modelling.

- Monitor and optimize key performance metrics: ACoS (Advertising Cost of Sales), TACoS (Total Advertising Cost of Sales), ROAS, ad conversion rate, organic sales lift, margin impact.

- Provide detailed reports and insights to: weekly/monthly performance review, actionable recommendations, forecast next period.

- Stay up to date with Amazon policy changes, ad product updates, algorithm changes, marketplace shifts and emerging best practices.

- Identify scaling opportunities while ensuring profitability: when to scale spend, when to pull back, how to optimize conversion vs traffic.

- Serve as an account leader for the company: manage expectations, communicate clearly, act proactively on issues (listing suppressions, account health, negative reviews).

- Work with automation/data tools and dashboards: pull/clean data, identify waste/spend inefficiencies, drive process improvement (e.g., by leveraging no-code automations, data pipelines).



Qualifications



- 2+ years of experience managing Amazon seller or vendor accounts (or equivalent e-commerce marketplace experience).

- Strong understanding of Amazon advertising ecosystem: Sponsored Products/Brands/Display, DSP, auto vs manual campaigns, bidding strategies, search term reports.

- Proven ability to improve ROAS/ACoS and profitability for Amazon accounts.

- Excellent analytical skills: ability to interpret data, create actionable insights, optimize campaigns based on performance.

- Experience with Amazon listing optimization: keyword research, SEO, copywriting (titles/bullets/A+), conversion-rate focus.

- Familiarity with Amazon account health, operations, inventory forecasting, and marketplace best practices.

- Comfortable being company-facing: strong communication, presentation skills, managing expectations, building trust. You will be communicating directly with the owners of the company.

- Self-starter, organized, able to manage multiple brands, accounts and projects concurrently.

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; experience with dashboards / BI tools a plus.

- Bonus: experience with automation tools, no-code platforms, AI-driven optimization (a growing focus).



KPIs / Success Measures



- Achieving or exceeding client ROAS/ACoS targets.

- Improvement in organic sales and overall account profitability.

- Reduction in wasted ad spending (negative keywords, inefficient campaigns).

- Client satisfaction and retention (renewals, upsells).

- Timely reporting and proactive account strategy updates.

- Efficient cross-team collaboration and issue resolution (listing suppressions, inventory, reviews, etc.).



What We Offer



- Working directly for a Canadian company with global opportunities

- Collaborative, high-performance environment.

- Competitive salary + performance bonus (tied to KPIs).

- Professional growth path: potentially moving into higher roles and moving to other countries.

- Hybrid opportunity (Mandaluyong City and remotely)

title: SEO & Content Manager
description:
We are looking for a detailed-oriented and proactive SEO Manager to take ownership of the online presence for multiple clients. This role is a hybrid of technical SEO, website management, and Local SEO, designed to increase organic traffic, improve website authority, and boost local rankings. The ideal candidate will handle everything from WordPress updates and on-page optimization to managing Google Business Profile (GBP) and building local citations.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Website Management & Technical SEO

Website Maintenance: Regular updates to the CMS (WordPress), including updating plugins, themes, and fixing broken links to ensure a smooth user experience.

On-Page Optimization: Optimize website content, including meta tags, meta descriptions, headers, and image alt text for target keywords.

Structured Data: Implement and manage Schema markup to enhance search results.

Technical Monitoring: Utilize Google Search Console to monitor and resolve crawl errors, indexation issues, and mobile-friendliness.

2. Local SEO & Content Strategy

GBP Management: Optimize and manage Google Business Profile (GBP), including posting, updating business information, and managing Q&As.

Content Creation: Post monthly to the website blog, FAQs, and service/location pages to target local search intent.

Citation Building: Identify, create, and maintain accurate citations (NAP: Name, Address, Phone) across local directories (Yelp, Yellow Pages, etc.).

Local Backlinks: Perform backlink audits, build local links, and find local sponsorship or partnership opportunities to increase domain authority.

3. Reporting & Strategy

Monthly Performance Reports: Create comprehensive monthly reports detailing keyword rankings, organic traffic, local pack visibility, and conversions. (BrightLocal)



Competitor Analysis: Analyze local competitors to identify content gaps and ranking opportunities. (BrightLocal)



Strategy Implementation: Stay updated on algorithm changes and adjust strategies to ensure long-term, sustainable growth.



equired Skills and Qualifications



Experience: 1+  years of experience as an SEO Manager or Specialist, with a strong focus on Local SEO.



Tools: Proficient in Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Google Search Console, and SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, LocalBrandManager, etc. (We can help you learn)



CMS Proficiency: Strong experience with WordPress (plugins, updating, basic troubleshooting).



Technical Knowledge: Basic understanding of HTML/CSS.



Local Expertise: Proven track record of improving Google Map pack rankings.



Preferred Qualifications:

Relevant SEO certifications (e.g., Google Analytics, HubSpot SEO).

Experience with local SEO for multi-location businesses.

Basic graphic design skills (e.g., Canva) for social/GBP posts.

title: Social Media Growth & Conversion Specialist
description:
This is a **gig-style role** to start, with a **clear path to becoming a full-time Department Head** for the right person.



I’m looking for a **high-level Social Media Growth & Conversion Specialist** who understands how to turn **authority, content, and reviews into real inbound leads** — not just likes, views, or followers.



I already have:



* A strong personal brand

* **High-volume Google My Business and Zillow reviews**

* Real-world results and trust in the market



What I need is someone who can **optimize, systemize, and scale** everything across platforms — then eventually **own this function end-to-end**.



This is **not a posting VA role**.

This is a **strategy + execution + leadership opportunity**.





## **KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**



### **Social Media & Platform Optimization**



* Optimize **YouTube** for lead generation:



  * SEO titles, descriptions, keywords, and tags

  * Clear calls-to-action for top, middle, and bottom funnel

  * High-conversion link structure

* Optimize **Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, and
**:



  * Bio and profile optimization

  * Caption formatting and CTA strategy

  * Pinned content and highlight strategy

  * Platform-specific execution (no copy-paste)



### **Reviews & Authority Leverage**



* Leverage **Google My Business reviews** to:



  * Increase trust and conversion

  * Integrate into social content and CTAs

* Repurpose **Zillow reviews** into:



  * Short-form social proof content

  * Funnel and landing page assets

  * Conversion-focused messaging



### **Funnels, Automation & CRM**



* Design and improve **Top / Middle / Bottom funnel systems**

* Audit and optimize **all link flows** (bio links, landing pages, forms)

* Ensure **all leads flow automatically into Follow Up Boss**

* Set up tagging, sources, and workflows for clean follow-up

* Improve lead quality through better intent filtering



### **Brand, Strategy & Leadership**



* Maintain brand consistency and premium positioning

* Track performance and optimize using data

* Bring creative ideas aligned with authority and conversion

* Over time: **build, document, and manage systems**

* Long-term: **lead this function as a department head**



## **WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR**



* You think in **systems, funnels, and leverage**

* You enjoy both **strategy and execution**

* You want **ownership**, not just tasks

* You’re excited by the idea of **building a department**, not just working in one





## **REQUIRED SKILLS**



* High-level digital marketing knowledge

* Strong **YouTube & social SEO**

* Funnel strategy (TOF / MOF / BOF)

* Copywriting & formatting for conversion

* CRM & automation experience (Follow Up Boss a big plus)

* Creative and analytical mindset

* Strong written English





## **BONUS (NOT REQUIRED BUT A PLUS)**



* Experience with **real estate or personal brands**

* Google My Business optimization experience

* Review-based marketing and social proof strategy

* Familiarity with Zapier, landing pages, or CRM automations

title: Systems & Automation Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 

 

About the Role 

In Financial Services is building a highly systemised, automation-led mortgage business designed around an exceptional client experience. 



Our focus is on removing friction at every stage of the loan lifecycle. Systems, automation, and AI are used to quietly handle data flow, documentation, task creation, and handovers across the entire loan lifecycle - from first enquiry through to submission, approval, settlement, and long-term review - so our clients feel supported and confident, and our team can focus on advice, problem-solving, and outcomes. 



We’re looking for a Systems & Automation Lead to work closely with the leadership team and alongside our established, high-performing offshore team in the Philippines. 



This role owns how our systems operate day to day. You’ll identify opportunities, improve workflows, and help shape how automation and AI support both our clients and our internal teams as the business continues to scale. 



This is a hands-on execution role for someone who enjoys building clean systems, improving efficiency, and working as part of a connected, collaborative remote team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>A client enters the business via an enquiry, referral, or campaign. From there: 

>>Client information flows cleanly into GoHighLevel (GHL) and into Broker Engine without duplication 

>>Meetings are booked with accurate pre-filled client data 

>>Client documents are guided, collected, named, and stored correctly 

>>Submission, approval, settlement, and post-settlement steps are system-led and automated where possible 

>>Tasks, notes, and handovers are created automatically for brokers and processing teams 

>>Ongoing reviews and retention workflows trigger without manual follow-up 



From the client’s perspective, the process feels clear, organised, and easy. 

From the team’s perspective, files are structured, complete, and ready to progress at every stage. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

>>Own the build, optimisation, and ongoing improvement of workflows across Broker Engine and GoHighLevel (GHL) 

>>Design and maintain integrations between Broker Engine, GHL, document storage, compliance workflows, and other systems using automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Automate workflows across the full mortgage lifecycle, including lead intake, data capture, submission, approval, settlement, post-settlement, and ongoing review 

>>Embed AI and Copilot-style tools into workflows to support meeting summaries, task creation, file notes, quality checks, and handovers 

>>Ensure client data and documents are captured, named, and stored correctly to support a seamless client experience 

>>Create role-based task automation so brokers and processing teams work from systems, not memory 

>>Document systems and workflows clearly, including SOPs, process maps, and short training guides 

>>Maintain a backlog of system, automation, and AI improvements and support continuous optimisation 

>>Support system setup and integration for new hires and future loan book acquisitions 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong hands-on experience building and maintaining advanced workflows in GoHighLevel, including pipelines, triggers, automations, forms, calendars, and multi-step client journeys 

>>Experience working with Broker Engine or similar mortgage broker CRMs 

>>Experience working with system integrations, including API-based connections, webhooks, and automation tools such as Zapier 

>>Practical experience applying AI tools (such as Copilot) within structured, repeatable workflows 

>>Solid understanding of mortgage or financial services workflows, including submission and post-settlement stages 

>>Highly process-driven with strong attention to detail 

>>Able to build, document, and explain systems clearly 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A marketing or funnel optimisation role 

(X) A compliance interpretation role 

(X) A strategy-only role 



You’ll be executing approved solutions within clear systems and governance. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian brokerage 

2. Work alongside an established offshore team in the Philippines 

3. Dedicated systems role within the offshore team, working closely with Australian leadership 

3. Strong team culture with daily collaboration via Microsoft Teams 

4. Opportunities to work on meaningful automation and AI initiatives that improve real client outcomes 

5. Clear priorities, structured workflows, and high standards 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for excellence, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and we believe smart systems, automation, and great people working together make that possible. 

 

Next Steps 

If you enjoy building intelligent systems, embedding automation and AI into real workflows, and being part of a connected, high-performing remote team, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Community Manager (Reddit & Facebook): $800 USD p/m
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

Hours: Full-time, M-F | Flexible | 100% Remote



We're seeking a skilled Community Manager to actively grow and manage our Reddit presence and 
munity with paid customers - starting immediately.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create and manage daily engaging posts across multiple Reddit accounts

Respond quickly and professionally to customer inquiries in our 
munity

Engage with community members and foster meaningful discussions

title: Full-stack Developer *Superstar Only*
description:
Are you a systems-minded full-stack developer who thrives on clean code and seamless integrations?

  

Can you build high-performance web experiences, automate workflows, and connect tools like Stripe, Twilio, and AWS with confidence and speed?

  

Do you take ownership of projects, think in APIs, and love turning scattered tools into elegant systems that just work?

  

We’re looking for a Full-Stack Developer to join our remote team and help us build and scale the backend infrastructure that powers our digital product launches, sales funnels, messaging automation, and more.



This is a hands-on role that requires attention to detail, strong technical autonomy, and a builder’s mindset. You’ll be working at the core of our operations, developing the tech foundation that supports twice-per month product launches - a fast-paced, high-impact cycle critical to our business.



If you thrive on shipping solid, scalable code and enjoy solving real-world problems with clean, connected systems - we’d love to hear from you.



ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing holistic beauty company seeking the brightest, most talented minds to join our remote team. More details will be shared during the interview, but you’ll be working closely with one of the leading holistic beauty creators, with a global community of over 2.5 million followers and a reputation for innovation, impact, and integrity.



We move quickly, work collaboratively, and build things that scale.



THE ROLE: FULL-STACK DEVELOPER (API-Driven, MarTech Stack)



You’ll be responsible for:

• Developing high-performance landing pages and micro-sites for product launches

• Creating and maintaining REST APIs and webhooks to connect tools like Stripe, Twilio, and CRMs

• Deploying serverless functions to automate messaging, billing, and customer data flows

• Managing infrastructure on AWS (S3, CloudFront, Lambda)

• Owning the technical execution of backend processes that support twice-per-month launches



REQUIREMENTS



Core Technical Skills

• JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3

• React (or comparable component-based framework)

• Node.js + Express (or Python with FastAPI)

• TypeScript (preferred)

• Twilio API (SMS, WhatsApp)

• AWS (S3, Lambda, CloudFront, IAM, Route 53)

• REST API design & integration

• Git, CI/CD workflows, environment management



Data Handling

• Basic SQL or NoSQL

• Form data processing

• CRM API integration



You’re a fit if you…

• Write clean, maintainable, modular code

• Can work independently and ship with confidence

• Think in systems and thrive on API integration

• Have strong attention to detail and follow-through

• Enjoy solving problems with clear logic and clean architecture



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

• Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

• Stable high-speed internet connection

• Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

• Full-time opportunity

• Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

• Competitive pay

• Training and growth opportunities

• Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



BONUS SKILLS

Stripe Billing (subscriptions, invoices, advanced webhook automation)

• Experience with Shopify or e-commerce integrations

• Familiarity with Manychat JSON API

• Kajabi API/webhooks



Application Instructions

Since this is a long-term position, there will be an in-depth qualification process. If you believe you have what it takes, here is what to do next:



Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.

 


 

If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

title: Civil Works Estimator & Project Sourcing Executive
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW



We are supporting our client in engaging an experienced Civil Works Estimator to support pre-construction and bidding activities for civil and infrastructure projects. This role focuses on accurate cost estimation, quantity take-offs, and project sourcing, with the ability to work directly from civil and structural drawings, including CAD files.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Civil Estimating & Quantity Surveying

• Review and interpret civil, structural, and architectural drawings, including CAD files

• Break down drawings, BOQs, and project specifications to develop accurate cost estimates

• Perform detailed quantity take-offs for materials, labor, and equipment



Prepare estimates for:

• Earthworks / dirtworks

• Concrete works

• Asphalt works

• Road and bridge construction projects

• Validate project scopes, assumptions, and budgets in coordination with engineers or project managers

• Ensure estimates align with project requirements, industry standards, and best practices



Project Sourcing & Pre-Construction Support

• Support identification and tracking of potential civil and infrastructure projects

• Assist in bid preparation and pre-construction documentation

• Coordinate with suppliers, subcontractors, or internal teams as needed

• Maintain organized records of estimates, take-offs, and bid-related documents



Possible Executive Administrative Support (If Required)

• The Executive Partner is also assessed and capable of supporting executive administrative tasks if required by the client, subject to scope alignment, including:

• Calendar and
 management

• Meeting coordination and follow-ups

• Drafting reports, summaries, and internal documentation



TOOLS & SOFTWARE



The ideal candidate has experience or strong familiarity with:

• AGTEK (earthwork take-offs and modeling)

• Autodesk Civil 3D or equivalent CAD software

• Earthworks estimating software or similar tools

• Google Workspace and/or Microsoft Office 365

(All system and software access will be provided by the client.)



QUALIFICATIONS

Required:

• Proven experience as a Civil Estimator, Quantity Surveyor, or similar role

• Strong ability to read and interpret civil and structural drawings



Solid knowledge of:

• Concrete

• Asphalt

• Earthworks / dirtworks

• Familiarity with road and bridge construction projects

• Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills

• Strong written and verbal communication skills



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Degree in Civil Engineering or related field

• Licensed Civil Engineer

• Experience supporting infrastructure or large-scale civil projects



IMPORTANT NOTES

• US-CST Time Zone

• We are endorsing one (1) qualified Executive Partner for this role

• Everyone is welcome to apply

• Applications must be submitted through the designated link



WHY JOIN US?

• Permanent WFH

• Earn competitive rates in USD

• HMO provided after qualifying period (at company discretion)

• Bonuses and Allowances (at company discretion)

• Rate increases (performance based)



TO APPLY ??

title: Content Editor & Production Lead
description:
In Financial Services 

Remote | Full-time | Long-term Contract 



About the Role 

In Financial Services is a growing, award-winning mortgage brokerage building a strong digital presence through education-led video content distributed across multiple platforms, including YouTube and other digital channels. 



We’re looking for a Content Editor & Production Lead to own the full production of our video content - from raw footage through to final, publish-ready assets. 



Our content includes: 

>>Educational finance and property videos 

>>Trust-building client review and testimonial videos 

>>Short-form clips and video ad creatives 

>>Internal and client experience videos (e.g. updates, nurture campaigns) 



This is not a marketing strategy role and not a junior VA position. 



You’ll work closely with our Australian leadership and marketing team, taking approved content ideas and raw recordings and turning them into complete, production-ready content - including video edits, visuals, thumbnails, and uploads once approved. 



This role focuses on production ownership and execution excellence - supporting campaigns, ads, and client communications through high-quality content, while strategy, budgets, and performance optimisation sit with the marketing team. 

 

What Success Looks Like 

>>Educational long-form videos are edited, packaged, and published consistently across approved platforms 

>>Client review videos are polished, authentic, and professionally presented 

>>Thumbnails are clear, on-brand, and designed to support engagement 

>>Short-form clips and video ads are efficiently produced from long-form content 

>>Content is uploaded accurately once approved, with correct titles, descriptions, and basic formatting 

>>The marketing team is freed up to focus on growth, partnerships, and client experience 

>>Our content library becomes a valuable long-term asset for the business 

 

Key Responsibilities 



Long-Form Educational & Client Video Production 

>>Edit long-form educational videos (for YouTube, podcasts and other approved platforms), interviews, and presentations 

>>Edit client review and testimonial videos to a professional, trustworthy standard 

>>Clean audio, remove dead space, tighten pacing, and structure content for clarity 

>>Apply consistent branding, chapters, lower thirds, titles, and visual standards 



Short-Form Content & Ad Creative 

>>Cut long-form education and client review content into short-form clips 

>>Produce dynamic video ad creatives using approved messaging, visuals, overlays, and supporting assets 

>>Take raw footage and create interesting and unique videos that perform well on TikTok/Instagram and META ads.  

>>Ensure all creatives align with brand tone and guidelines 



Thumbnails & Visual Assets 

>>Design thumbnails and supporting visual assets for videos and ads 

>>Maintain a consistent thumbnail style and branding 

>>Make revisions based on internal feedback (analytics ownership not required) 



Content Upload & Publishing Support 

>>Upload approved content to platforms (e.g. video platforms, ad platforms, social platfoms) 

>>Apply approved titles, descriptions, tags, chapters, and basic formatting 

>>Ensure content is published correctly and on schedule once approved 



Content Production Flow 

>>Manage the end-to-end production workflow from raw files ? published assets 

>>Maintain clear file naming, version control, and content organisation 

>>Work closely with the marketing team to meet publishing schedules 



Quality Control & Consistency 

>>Ensure all content meets quality and brand standards before publishing 

>>Maintain consistency across long-form, short-form, ads, and thumbnails 

>>Flag opportunities to improve production efficiency or quality 

 

Skills & Experience 

>>Strong experience producing education-led long-form video content end to end for multiple platforms 

>>Experience editing client review or testimonial videos 

>>Experience creating thumbnails and simple video ad creatives 

>>Confident using professional editing tools (Premiere Pro, Capcut, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve, or similar) 

>>Comfortable creating thumbnails using tools such as Photoshop, Canva, or similar 

>>Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and clarity for educational content 

>>Excellent attention to detail and pride in clean, polished work 

>>Able to manage multiple projects without quality dropping 

>>Able to work independently on video production and confident to produce original ideas  



Highly Regarded (Not Essential): 

>>Experience creating video content that supports paid ads,
 campaigns, or client nurture journeys 

>>Experience working within content-led businesses where long-form video supports audience growth, trust, and client acquisition 

 

This Role Is Not 

(X) A content strategy or growth role 

(X) A paid ads management role 

(X) A performance analytics role 

(X) A junior VA position 



You’ll be responsible for production and delivery, not deciding what content to create or how campaigns perform. 

 

Why Join Us 

1. Long-term, stable role with a growing Australian business 

2. Clear expectations and structured workflows 

3. Work alongside a collaborative offshore and Australian team 

4. Purpose-driven content focused on education and trust (not clickbait) 

5. Opportunity to grow with the business as content output scales 

 

About In Financial Services 

With over 20 years of success, In Financial Services has built a reputation for education, innovation, and genuine client care. 

Our purpose is simple - to empower financial dreams through education, inspiration, and support - and our content plays a key role in delivering that mission. 

 

Next Steps 

To apply, please include: 

>>Examples of long-form educational videos you’ve produced 

>>Examples of thumbnails and ad creatives you’ve created 

>>A brief summary of your content production experience 

>>Your expected monthly rate
