title: Remote Administrative Assistant & Outbound Calling Specialist
description:
Remote Administrative Assistant + Outbound Calling Specialist



Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Role



About Us



DivaDance is a fast-growing dance fitness company based in the United States with studios across North America. We help adults feel confident and empowered through dance classes and community.



We are looking for a reliable, long-term remote team member to support our studio operations, help book clients into classes, and assist with daily administrative tasks.



This is a stable, long-term role with opportunity to grow as the company grows.



?



Role Overview



This role is a mix of:

 • Administrative support

 • Customer support

 • Outbound calling and texting

 • Data entry and system updates



Your main goal is to help us turn leads into booked clients and keep our systems organized.



?



Primary Responsibilities



1) Outbound Calls + Booking Leads into Classes (MOST IMPORTANT)



You will call and text people in the United States who have expressed interest in our classes and help them get booked.



Tasks include:

 • Calling new leads who signed up for info

 • Calling past clients who haven’t returned

 • Sending follow-up texts and voi
s

 • Answering basic questions about classes

 • Helping people choose a class time

 • Booking clients into classes using our scheduling software (Mindbody)

 • Following up with leads who do not respond

 • Tracking call outcomes daily



This is a friendly, warm calling role — not cold sales.



?



2) Client Account & Scheduling Support (Mindbody)



You will help manage client accounts and class rosters.



Tasks include:

 • Entering clients into class rosters

 • Fixing client account issues

 • Extending trials or passes when instructed

 • Applying credits and correcting purchases

 • Updating client notes

 • Running basic reports



Training will be provided.



?



3) General Administrative Support



You will help with daily tasks that keep operations running smoothly.



Examples:

 • Data entry and spreadsheet updates

 • Inbox and follow-ups

 • Simple marketing support tasks

 • Miscellaneous admin projects



?



Required Skills

 • Excellent written and spoken English

 • Comfortable speaking on the phone with U.S. customers

 • Friendly and confident personality

 • Highly organized and detail-oriented

 • Reliable internet and quiet workspace

 • Able to follow processes and checklists

 • Tech-comfortable and quick learner



?



Bonus Skills (Not Required)

 • Experience with Mindbody or scheduling software

 • Customer service or call center experience

 • Experience working for a U.S. company

 • Experience using CRM or marketing tools



?



Work Schedule

 • Full-time, 40 hours/week

 • Must be available during U.S. business hours (Central Time)

 • Some evening availability required



?



Compensation & Growth

 • Competitive monthly pay (based on experience)

 • Paid training

 • Long-term role with growth opportunities

 • Opportunity to take on more responsibility over time

title: Transaction Coordinator - Real Estate| Full Time | 13month Bonus + Yearly Raises
description:
About Our Company:

The Growth Consultant is a leading business consulting company that helps entrepreneurs streamline operations, strengthen internal systems, and reduce daily workload so they can focus on growth and scaling. We support real estate professionals by providing reliable operational and administrative support that ensures transactions are handled accurately, efficiently, and in full compliance from contract to close.



Job Summary:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Transaction Coordinator – Real Estate to oversee all administrative, compliance, and documentation requirements throughout the lifecycle of real estate transactions. This role serves as the central point of coordination between agents, clients, lenders, inspectors, and escrow/title companies—ensuring every file is complete, deadlines are met, and transactions progress smoothly to closing.



The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with real estate contracts, disclosures, and transaction workflows and is comfortable managing multiple transactions in a fast-paced, fully remote environment.



Key Responsibilities:



Transaction Management & Compliance

- Manage real estate transactions from executed contract through closing

- Prepare, review, and organize contracts, disclosures, addenda, and supporting documents

- Ensure all transaction files are accurate, complete, and compliant with brokerage policies and real estate regulations

- Track critical deadlines, contingencies, and milestones to prevent delays



Coordination & Communication

- Act as the primary liaison between real estate agents, clients, lenders, inspectors, and escrow/title companies

- Schedule inspections, appraisals, walkthroughs, and other transaction-related appointments

- Provide regular transaction status updates to agents and internal teams

- Proactively follow up on missing documents or outstanding items



Documentation & File Organization

- Maintain well-organized digital transaction files and records

- Upload, track, and manage signed documents and disclosures

- Ensure all required paperwork is completed and submitted on time



Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience as a Transaction Coordinator or in real estate administrative support

- Strong knowledge of real estate contracts, disclosures, and compliance requirements

- Experience coordinating with lenders, escrow/title companies, and third-party vendors

- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

- Strong written and verbal English communication skills

- Ability to manage multiple transactions simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment

- Tech-savvy and comfortable using CRMs or transaction management systems

- Reliable internet connection and professional remote work setup



We Offer:

Fully remote position

13th-month pay

Annual salary increases

Supportive and collaborative team environment

Long-term growth opportunities within the company

title: Appointment Setter (1+ years experience)
description:
Join Huzzle’s Talent Pool as an Appointment Setter here: 



At Huzzle, we connect top-tier Appointment Setters & SDRs with leading companies across the UK, US, and Europe. Whether it’s a startup, scale-up, agency, or enterprise, our clients trust us to find the best talent. We only admit the top 3% of candidates into our talent pool, ensuring they are matched with exclusive, long-term opportunities. Unlike an outsourcing agency, we place you directly with a client where you’re hired in-house to work full-time as a valued member of their team.



WHO THIS IS FOR:

You're looking to:

• Work with top-tier clients in the industry and secure long-term, stable opportunities.

• Advance your career through access to exclusive roles and ongoing professional development.

• Be valued and respected for your skills and contributions in a supportive work environment.

• Earn a competitive salary with regular pay increases and success-based bonuses.

• Stop fighting for opportunities across different platforms, and let us match you with roles where we believe you'll excel.



And if you're:

• Tired of job-hopping and want a stable, long-term position.

• Frustrated by lack of support or training in previous roles.

• Looking for meaningful work where your contributions are recognized and rewarded.

• Eager to work full-time for a reputable company that values your expertise.



What We Offer:

Competitive Pay: Starting at 30K PHP/month with regular pay raises and success-based bonuses:

• Month 1: 30K PHP/month + bonus

• Month 3: 33K PHP/month + bonus

• Month 6: 36K PHP/month + bonus

• Month 9: 38K PHP/month + bonus

Exclusive Access: Work with top companies and enjoy long-term client relationships.

Work from Anywhere: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely, from the comfort of your home.



Your Role as an Appointment Setter:

• Proactive Outreach: Engage potential clients and partners through phone,
, and social media platforms.

• Seamless Scheduling: Coordinate meetings and manage calendars for the sales teams, ensuring a smooth experience for both the team and potential clients.

• CRM Mastery: Keep meticulous records of all interactions, appointments, and follow-up activities in a CRM system.

• Database Management: Regularly update and review the contact database to maintain accuracy and relevancy.

• Active Communication: Collaborate with sales and marketing to understand offerings and effectively communicate the value proposition.

• Optimize & Succeed: Monitor appointment success rates and work closely with the team to refine strategies for higher conversions.

• Industry Savvy: Stay updated on industry trends to engage clients effectively and address their needs.





Who We're Looking For:

• Experience: At least 1 years of experience with Appointment Setting, Cold Calling, and Outbound Messaging (LinkedIn, Cold
s).

• Sales Tools Proficiency: Familiarity with relevant sales and outreach tools (CRMs, Prospecting Tools, Automation Tools, etc).

• Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with clients.

• Organizational Skills: Excellent time management and the ability to juggle multiple schedules.

• Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Google Docs, Google Sheets, CRM systems, and communication tools like Slack, ChatGPT, Zoom, and LinkedIn.

• Remote Ready: Able to work effectively in a remote environment with a reliable laptop and internet connection.

• Detail-Oriented: A keen eye for detail and a commitment to maintaining high-quality data in systems.



 Our Hiring Process:

• Step 1: Screening Interview

• Step 2: Take-home Task

• Step 3: Successful candidates are admitted to our talent pool, gaining access to exclusive opportunities.

• Step 4: We match you with a client for a final interview.



Application Requirements:

1. Make sure the Subject of the application is the name of the Capital City of Canada otherwise your application won't be reviewed.

2. Share your Resume/CV and any relevant experience / projects you've worked on.

3. Send anything else that can set you apart!

title: Financial Accountant - AU Company
description:
Who is Bare?

Bare is the new way to funeral. We are a holistic end of life care provider, allowing our families to grieve in their own way, at their own pace, knowing their loved one is cared for by a team who truly understand their needs.



By combining empathy with technology, we’re creating end-of-life experiences that are simple, personalized and affordable. In only five years, we’ve served more than 30,000 families, have become Australia’s most awarded end-of-life provider (with awards in customer service, innovation and digital disruption), and have built a team of more than 100 people committed to changing the way Australians deal with end-of-life. And we’re just getting started.



We’re looking for a passionate and detail-oriented Financial Accountant to join our high-performing remote team. If you're a proactive finance professional who thrives on ownership, continuous improvement, and meaningful work, we’d love to meet you.



What You’ll Be Doing

As our Financial Accountant, you’ll be a key player in ensuring accurate, insightful, and timely financial reporting. You’ll collaborate across teams, drive process improvement, and uphold the financial integrity of our mission.



Key Responsibilities:

-Own the Month-End Close

Lead all aspects of EOM: journal entries, reconciliations, accruals, and financial statement prep.

-Deliver Insightful Reporting

Produce monthly and quarterly management reports, including variance and trend analysis.

-Ensure Regulatory Compliance

Prepare BAS, IAS, and statutory filings, ensuring alignment with AASB and tax standards.

-Champion Continuous Improvement

Streamline workflows, introduce automation, and enhance internal controls.

-Collaborate Cross-Functionally

Partner with Marketing, Operations, and other non-finance teams to align on budget and strategy.

-Support Strategic Projects

Get involved in cost analysis, ERP upgrades, and special projects that shape our financial future.



Why Join Bare?

Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work directly supports families during one of the most vulnerable times of their lives.

Remote-First Flexibility: Work from anywhere in Australia with the tools and autonomy to succeed.

Mission-Driven Culture: Join a team that leads with empathy and integrity—where your voice matters.

Growth & Innovation: Help shape scalable systems in a business that's growing fast and disrupting the norm.



About You

You’re not just technically sharp, you bring heart and high standards to everything you do. You thrive in fast-paced environments and care about doing work that matters.



Must-Haves:

-Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or similar.

-CPA/CA qualification (or in-progress).

-2–3+ years' experience in financial accounting, ideally in service-led sectors.

-Familiarity with Australian accounting standards, BAS/IAS, and financial reporting.

-Understanding of various accounting standards relevant to Bare and consolidations of many entities.

-Attention to detail and excellent reconciliation skills

-Strong ERP (MYOB, Xero, SAP) and Excel skills.

-Strong Excel/Sheets skills and automation of manual processes in your mindset-DNA



Nice-to-Haves:

• Experience in mission-driven sectors (healthcare, aged care, funeral services).

• Adaptability in high-growth or high-volume environments.

• Resilient, working with little or no supervision.

• Experience of managing international teams, interaction with multi-entity organizations, and experience within companies with a minimum annual revenue of $50 million.

• Handle ambiguity, competing priorities, and strict deadlines. Create and implement scalable processes, including training. Integrate AI and automation.



Core Values We Look For

• Empathy: You care deeply about people—colleagues and customers alike.

• Accountability: You take ownership and deliver results with pride.

• Clarity: You communicate financial information in a clear, human way.

• Curiosity: You’re always looking for a better way and love solving problems.



Perks & Benefits

-Fully remote work setup with flexible hours

-Purpose-driven work with real human impact

-Growth and learning opportunities in a scale-up environment

-Supportive, inclusive team culture

title: Short-Form Video Editor (DaVinci Resolve)
description:
We’re looking for a skilled short-form video editor to help us produce high-quality social content. This role is focused on execution, consistency, and quality. You’ll be working with real client footage, clear direction on video topics, and creative freedom to add flare where it fits.



This is not a beginner role. We need someone who is confident in their editing skills, understands pacing and storytelling for short-form content, and can adapt to different client styles based on inspiration and examples we provide.



What you’ll be editing:



• 20–25 short-form videos per month total

• Videos range from 15–60 seconds

• Content is primarily Reels and TikTok-style videos

• Footage may be vertical or horizontal and comes from iPhone, Sony cameras, and DJI drones

• You’ll be given the topic or direction for each video, but you are expected to review footage, find strong moments, and build the edit yourself



What we’re looking for:



• Proven experience editing short-form content for social media (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

• Strong proficiency in DaVinci Resolve

• Ability to cull footage and make smart creative decisions without needing frame-by-frame direction

• Solid understanding of pacing, hooks, and visual flow for short-form video

• Experience with color correction and basic color grading to achieve a clean, polished look

• Comfortable working with both luxury-style branding and the occasional trend-driven edit•

• Up to date with social media trends and what keeps content engaging, without overdoing it

• Clear and accurate English for on-screen text when used for emphasis in talking-head videos

• Able to adapt quickly to different client styles using inspiration links, reference videos, and examples we provide

• Audio and style notes

• Audio guidelines and trending sounds will be provided

• You are not expected to find trending audio on your own

• Captions and off-screen copy are not required in most cases

• On-screen text should be clean, intentional, and easy to read when used



Workflow expectations:



• Content is typically delivered in batches

• Final edited videos should be delivered within 3 business days of receiving footage

• One revision is standard, though most videos will not require revisions

• You should be comfortable receiving feedback and making quick adjustments when needed



Time commitment

• Approximately 10–12 hours per week

• Work is usually needed 2–3 weeks out of each month



This role is a good fit if



• You take pride in clean, intentional edits

• You can follow direction but don’t need hand-holding

• You care about quality and consistency

• You’re comfortable adapting to different client styles over time

• You want steady, ongoing editing work rather than one-off projects

title: Junior Web Developer
description:
ABOUT DISPENZA

Dispenza has quickly become one of the largest marketing agencies in the rapidly-growing emerging market of cannabis as it quickly legalizes state by state in the Americas. As the market matures, we are on a mission to help change how the market operates, leaving the more questionable activities done by current market leaders and emerge as the first marketing agency and platform that values our customers while simultaneously delivering business-changing results to our clients.



JOB OVERVIEW

We are seeking an experienced WordPress Elementor Developer with a strong focus on front-end development, particularly in CSS and Bootstrap, to create high-end custom websites. You will play a crucial role in delivering pixel-perfect, fast, and user-friendly designs. No scripting or backend knowledge is required — just a passion for styling and optimizing websites for performance.



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



FRONT END DEVELOPMENT

- Building and styling custom websites using a CMS similar to WordPress and Elementor, with a heavy emphasis on CSS and Bootstrap.

- Implementing clean, well-organized code and ensuring responsive design across all devices.

- Collaborating with the design team to bring mockups from Figma into functional websites.

- Ensuring optimal website performance (load time, speed, etc.) by leveraging front-end best practices.

- Customizing Builder widgets and templates to meet specific design needs.

- Troubleshooting front-end issues and providing quick resolutions.





TEAM COLLABORATION

- Working alongside project managers to complete tasks as part of the team’s development process.

- Participating in team meetings to discuss project progress and suggest new tools or techniques.



REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Expert-Level Front-End Development: Mastery of CSS, HTML, and Bootstrap for building responsive and visually stunning websites.

- 3+ years experience in WordPress, Elementor, and front-end styling.

- Proven experience with Bootstrap to build flexible, grid-based layouts and components.

- Proficiency with Figma to translate design into functional front-end code.

- Strong attention to detail with an ability to deliver pixel-perfect designs.

- Experience with API integrations at the front-end level (e.g., integrating third-party services or data into the front end).

- Excellent organizational skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

- Comfortable working independently and as part of a cross-functional team.

- Strong communication skills for interacting with designers, project managers, and clients.



DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Fast typing speed (80+ words per minute).

- Experience with GSuite (Docs, Sheets, Calendar).

- Familiarity with ClickUp or similar project management tools.

- Experience using Slack or similar team communication platforms.

- Proactive in identifying and solving front-end challenges.



COMPENSATION

$750-$1,000 USD per month



SCHEDULE

- 8 hour shift, Tuesday to Saturday, 7:00am to 4:00pm Manila Time.

- Minimal overtime during weekdays and weekends will be expected as part of salary



Dispenza is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, wordpressage, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.



If you’re a passionate front-end developer with a strong background in CSS and Bootstrap and are looking for a position where you can focus purely on design and styling, we want to hear from you!





HOW TO APPLY

Please fill out the following form in order for your application to be considered: 





Good luck!

description:

We are seeking an experienced Government Contract Research Specialist with hands-on experience to help identify small federal contract opportunities that align with our business capabilities.



This role is focused on opportunity discovery, filtering, and qualification, not proposal writing (at this stage). You will use SAM.gov along with AI-powered platforms to streamline searches, analyze opportunities, and surface contracts that are realistic and actionable.



This is a results-driven role. If you successfully help secure a contract, we are open to negotiating a small performance-based percentage in addition to your hourly rate.



Key Responsibilities

Search and monitor SAM for relevant federal contracting opportunities

Identify small, low-barrier contracts suitable for early wins

Use AI tools (such as Lumen and similar platforms) to:

Speed up opportunity discovery

Summarize solicitations

Identify compliance requirements

Eligibility and set-aside requirements

Agency

Deadline

Contract value (if available)

Basic requirements and next steps

Government contracting basics

NAICS codes

Set-asides and eligibility criteria

Tell us your favorite social media account to follow for video inspiration and why.



Only applications that follow all steps above will be reviewed.

Why Work With Us?

- Supportive team with clear processes and creative freedom.

- Opportunity to advance into a creative directing or hybrid video role.

- Long-term consistent work for the right candidate 



Ready to join our creative team?



Apply now—let’s grow together!





About Us



Mail To Profit, LLC is a fast-growing digital marketing company based in Texas, USA. We help our clients grow through
 marketing, social media, and high-converting ad creatives. Our team is small, supportive, and values creative problem-solving, clear communication, and a commitment to quality work. We’re looking for talented individuals who want to grow with us and take pride in their craft.

title: HR Assistant
description:
This role is responsible for sourcing, screening, and coordinating top talent for real estate positions. The ideal candidate has recruiting experience, understands real estate roles, and can manage multiple hiring pipelines efficiently in a remote environment.



Job Description:

1. Support full-cycle recruitment for real estate and administrative roles, including Agents, Transaction Coordinators, Property Managers, Leasing Agents, and Admin/VA positions.

2. Create, post, and manage job advertisements across relevant job platforms and social channels.

3. Proactively source candidates via job boards, LinkedIn, and internal/external databases.

4. Screen resumes and conduct initial candidate interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit.

5. Coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring smooth scheduling and communication.

6. Maintain accurate candidate pipelines and recruitment trackers to support hiring decisions.

7. Communicate professionally and timely with candidates throughout the hiring process.

8. Assist with onboarding preparation and hiring documentation as needed.

9. Maintain organized recruitment records and ensure data accuracy.

10. Provide general HR administrative support and assist with other HR-related tasks as assigned.



Qualifications: 

1. Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or related field

2. Experience as an HR Recruiter or Recruitment VA

3. Experience recruiting for real estate roles (preferred)

4. Strong English communication skills

5. Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

6. Ability to work independently and remotely

7. Can work Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours

title: Property Sourcing and Follow Up Lead
description:
We're a growing short-term rental business in the US scaling to 20+ properties this year. We're looking for a reliable, organized VA to help find and manage property leads then follow up with people through
 and phone calls. Part time now, with potential for full-time.



They should be a motivated, detail-oriented professional with strong research skills and excellent communication abilities. You'll be responsible for identifying rental properties that fit our housing model, conducting outreach to property owners, and qualifying leads. As our portfolio grows, you'll also support guest communications and operational coordination.



**Main Tasks** 



* Pull rental listings from Zillow, Apartments.com,
 Marketplace, Craigslist (50-100+ per week)  

* Analyze market rental rates and qualify leads   

* Respond to property inquiries via messaging platforms,
, and phone calls   

* Follow up with leads using provided templates   

* Track all outreach, responses, and lead status in our system  

* Schedule property viewings  

* Build genuine rapport with through professional, friendly communication



**??What We’re Looking For**



**Required:**



* **Excellent English communication skills** \- both written and spoken, with natural, conversational tone  

* **Ability to build rapport quickly** \- you're personable, warm, and professional (not stiff or robotic)  

* Previous experience with outreach, lead generation, market research, or sales  

* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail  

* Comfortable with Google Sheets/Excel and basic data analysis  

* Self-motivated and able to work independently  

* Can manage multiple tasks and follow through consistently  

* **Can craft personalized messages** outside of the given generic templates



**Preferred (Not Required):**



* Experience with Airbnb, real estate, property management, or corporate housing  

* Familiarity with rental market research  

* Background in customer service or hospitality where building relationships was key  

* Previous cold outreach experience with strong response rates



**You're NOT The Right Fit If:**



* You're uncomfortable having natural phone conversations with strangers  

* You need constant supervision and hand-holding on every task  

* You struggle with organization or tracking multiple conversations  

* You're uncomfortable with outreach or following up persistently  

* You avoid taking initiative when problems arise



**Working Hours**



* Project-based: 15-20 hours per week to start  

* Philippine timezone \- flexible schedule during your working hours  

* Strong potential to become full-time (40+ hours) as we grow to 10-20 properties



**Rate** ? 230-290 per hour ($4-5/hour) depending on experience



**How to Apply**



If you're organized, personable, and excited to help build a growing business, we'd love to hear from you.



**To apply, kindly fill out this form:**



[
](
)

title: Social Media Manager - Multiple Projects
description:
Part-Time Social Media & Content Manager (Long-Term | SaaS Startup)



Company: VixHQ

Type: Part-time / Remote

Pay: $350 per month

Schedule: Flexible, outcome-based

Growth: Long-term role with opportunity to grow



About the Role



I’m the founder of a growing SaaS startup building AI-powered tools for real estate businesses. I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented social media and content manager to help turn demos, recordings, and ideas into consistent content across:



YouTube



TikTok



Instagram






LinkedIn



Experience working with a SaaS startup or online software business is a strong advantage and will make you a highly considered candidate.



What You’ll Do



Create social media content from Looms, Zoom calls, and written ideas



Repurpose one piece of content into multiple formats



Schedule and publish posts consistently using a scheduler



Help improve simple, repeatable content workflows



Communicate clearly and meet deadlines



Who This Role Is For



Someone with experience supporting a SaaS startup, tech company, or online business



Comfortable working directly with a founder



Organized, dependable, and proactive



Interested in long-term, stable remote work



Willing to learn new tools and improve over time



What This Role Is Not



Not influencer or personal brand content



Not one-time or short-term work



Not design-only posting



How to Apply (Important)



To be considered, please answer all screening questions below. Applications without answers will not be reviewed.



Screening Questions (Required)



1. Have you worked with a SaaS startup, software company, or online business before?



If yes, briefly describe the company and your role.



If no, explain why you believe you can succeed in this role.



2. Share 2–3 examples of social media content you created for a business.



What was the goal of the content (engagement, leads, awareness, etc.)?



3. If given a 10–15 minute Loom video explaining a product, how would you turn it into social media content for one week?



Briefly describe your process.



4. What tools have you used for content creation or scheduling?



(Example: Canva, CapCut, ChatGPT, Hootsuite, Buffer, etc.)



5. This role pays $350/month to start and is part-time. Are you comfortable with this compensation and looking for a long-term role?



Yes / No (please explain briefly)



Final Note



I’m looking for someone reliable who wants long-term remote work, not just short-term tasks. If you do good work, communicate well, and take ownership, this role can grow over time.

title: Video Editor -- Content Short-Form and Long-Form
description:
This is not the same as a "mechanical" editing role. The job is to take video and turn it into content that holds retention, communicates a clear message, and tells a story. Editing skills alone won't suffice. Content judgment is a priority.



You will be responsible for shaping ideas, pacing, hooks, structure, and clarity. You will have access to SOPs to follow.



Turn raw talking-head, podcast, or training footage into high-retention content.



Turn raw talking-head, podcast, or training footage into high-retention content



Identify the core message in a video and edit around it



Create strong hooks in the first 1–3 seconds



Cut for pacing, clarity, and emphasis, not aesthetics alone



Add captions, zooms, sound effects, and b-roll only when they increase comprehension or retention



Edit primarily for short-form platforms (Reels, TikTok, Shorts); long-form a plus



What You Must Understand



Why certain edits increase watch time



How pacing changes retention



How to trim fat without killing meaning



Difference between “looking good” and “performing well”



Basic content psychology (hooks, payoff, clarity, contrast)



Required Skills



Strong editing fundamentals (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or equivalent)



Fluent in English (spoken and written)



Proven experience editing short-form content



Ability to think independently and make editorial decisions



Not Required



Motion graphics expertise



Complex VFX



Over-editing for style

title: VA Social Media Outreach Specialist / QC & Delivery Specialist (Hybrid Role)
description:
I am looking for someone smart, friendly, organized, and excited to grow with us! If you’re a positive, detail-oriented person who loves to learn, takes feedback well, and wants to be part of a fast growing team — I'd love to meet you.



This is a long-term role for someone who’s ready to take on more responsibility over time and become a key part of our journey together.



Who are we?



Taalbi Real Estate Media is a fun real estate media company based in Wisconsin, USA. We create amazing photo and video content for realtors, and we’re known for our fast turnaround, friendly service, and high-quality work. Our team is small, growing quickly, and we’re passionate about doing great work, expanding the envelope, and loving the team we work with. We value doing things well, smartly, and with ease.



If you’re looking for a place where your ideas matter, you’ll be supported, and you can grow — this might be the perfect fit.





We are looking for a team member to handle two key roles:

1. Social Media Outreach Specialist

Identify, engage with, and DM real estate agents using our proven system to book free first shoots

2. QC & Delivery Specialist

Review, edit & send media, manage project workflows and deliver to clients.



Responsibilities:



Social Media Outreach

Engage (like, comment) with our social media ecosystem

Be our voice online

Track responses and bookings in our system (monday.com CRV)

Maintain daily outreach volume

Create content for posting





Quality Control + Delivery

Review edited real estate photos for lighting, color, and consistency

Make basic fixes in an editing program like Photoshop or Lightroom (object removal, color)

Use Spiro.media to organize deliverables, and deliver to clients

Manage daily project timelines and deliverables

Communicate with team via Slack

Ensure all final files are high-quality and on time





Requirements:

Willingness to work in central time zone (7a.m. to 3p.m.)

Excellent written English

Friendly, creative, positive, and coachable

Experience in Lightroom or Photoshop

Experience in Canva

Experience with using a CRM (we use Monday.com CRM)

Able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously

Highly organized, detail-oriented, fast learner

Keen eye for quality work



Ideal Candidate:

Fun happy person to work with

Extremely detail oriented

Strong communicator

Reliable and self-managed

Creative, friendly and fun

Process-driven and consistent

Enjoys both outreach and operational work



To Apply:

Please send your résumé and record a video of yourself answering these 3 questions



1)Tell us about yourself — what do you love?



2)Tell us about your past work experience and how it relates to this job. Why would you be a great fit for Taalbi Real Estate Media?



3)Do you have any leadership or management experience?

title: AI Thumbnail Artist for Romance Story YouTube Channel
description:
We are looking for a Thumbnail Artist to create eye-catching thumbnails for romance story content and others kind of content in the future.



This role is not about complex illustrations or advanced Photoshop art. The key skills we are looking for are:



* Strong understanding of what makes a thumbnail clickable



* Ability to use AI image generation tools (Whisk, Nano Banana, ChatGpt,  etc.)



* Good visual intuition for romance, emotion, tension, and storytelling



* Basic image editing skills to refine AI outputs (cropping, contrast, text placement if needed)



What You’ll Do



* Generate images using AI tools based on story themes



* Select or refine visuals that grab attention and trigger curiosity



* Adapt thumbnails to a romance / emotional storytelling style



* Ensure thumbnails are clear, readable, and effective at small sizes



* Follow simple guidelines and references provided



What We’re Looking For



* Experience using AI image generation tools



* Understanding of YouTube thumbnail psychology (emotion, faces, contrast, focus)



* Ability to work fast and iterate when needed



* Familiarity with romance aesthetics (love, drama, intimacy, tension)



* Reliability and good communication



Nice to Have



* Previous experience with YouTube thumbnails



* Basic Photoshop / Canva skills



* Interest in romance stories or storytelling content



Important Notes



* This is not high-end digital art



* Creativity + AI + marketing mindset is more important than drawing skills



*Long-term collaboration possible if the fit is good



If you have experience creating thumbnails that make people click, especially using AI tools, we’d love to hear from you.



Salary 150usd/month for 4h monday-friday (20h/week) 



We are working on a comission system based on the views of the channel. If your thumbnails bring more views, you will earn more money. But we currently did not implemented yet.

title: Roofing Estimator & Supplementer
description:
I'm seeking a skilled Estimator & Supplementer for my Roofing business. This dual role ensures accurate project estimating and maximized insurance restoration revenue. You will be responsible for preparing detailed estimates for roofing projects, reviewing insurance claims, identifying missed items, and negotiating supplements with insurance adjusters.

My ideal candidate should have experience in roofing or construction, strong attention to detail, and excellent negotiation skills.



Key Responsibilities:

Estimating

Prepare detailed and accurate estimates for roofing projects using Xactimate or other estimating software.

Perform takeoffs, measure roof dimensions, and calculate material, labor, and equipment costs.

Collaborate with sales and production teams to ensure bids reflect project scope and client needs.

Maintain updated cost databases and ensure pricing aligns with current market rates.



Supplementing

title: Short-Form Video Producer (HeyGen Avatar + Higgsfield B-roll + CapCut)
description:
We’re hiring a short-form producer who can make AI-led videos feel cohesive, intentional, and high-retention.

Our audience is senior product leaders and founders. Smart, time-poor, and allergic to fluff.



What you’ll produce (30–60s)

Reels / TikTok / Shorts built around:

- A consistent HeyGen AI avatar (same “host” across episodes)

- Higgsfield B-roll creation (screens, proof moments, environmental inserts)

- Clean, tight editing that feels designed, not stitched

- Posting-ready captions (required)



Primary goal- Make the videos feel like one recognizable series:

- One consistent host

- Visuals that change with intent

- Pacing that holds attention

- Proof-led b-roll (not generic filler)

- Your responsibilities (must-haves)

- HeyGen (Avatar production + direction)

- Build avatar scenes with consistent look, framing, energy, and tone

- Adjust the avatar’s tone of voice, pacing, hand movements, and facial expressions to match the script and moment

- Direct scenes so delivery feels natural (not robotic or stiff)

- Maintain continuity across episodes (same host, same “show” language)



Higgsfield (B-roll creation)

- Generate or source b-roll that supports the point (screens, artifacts, situations)

- Use b-roll as proof, not decoration

- Match b-roll tone to the episode (serious when needed, lighter when appropriate)



Editing (CapCut / Premiere / AE)

- Tight pacing

- Clean audio mix

- Intentional pauses

- Continuity so it feels designed, not stitched

- Enforce pacing: cuts, cadence, and timing (non-negotiable)



Captions

- Must generate the same style consistantly



Tools / stack (required)

- HeyGen

- Higgsfield

- CapCut / Premiere / AE (any is fine as long as output quality is strong)



Nice-to-have

- Veo3

- Grok (or adjacent AI tooling for workflow)



What “good” looks like

- Hook lands in the first 1–2 seconds

- Visuals change every few seconds with intent

- The avatar reads as one recognizable host (not a patchwork of clips)

- Tone and delivery are controlled (voice, hands, expressions feel intentional)

- B-roll proves the point (screens, artifacts, moments), not generic filler

- Pacing is tight and watchable all the way through



Examples that need guidance (vibe/pacing isn’t there yet)







How to apply

Send:

2–3 examples of short-form you’ve produced (AI video preferred)

A quick breakdown of your workflow: HeyGen ? Higgsfield ? edit ? caption

Confirm you can adjust avatar performance (tone, voice pacing, gestures, expressions)

Your rate (per video and/or weekly batch) + weekly capacity

title: Creative Specialist/Strategist (General Fashion Dropshipping Experience Required)
description:
Summary

Creative Strategist & Static Ad Specialist — Fashion Dropshipping



About the Company

We are a fast-growing dropshipping company in the fashion niche. Our goal is simple: create scroll-stopping, high-converting static ads that consistently perform across Meta platforms, supported by strong angles, messaging, and proven creative frameworks.



We are looking for an experienced Creative Strategist / Ad Creative Specialist with a primary focus on static advertisements. You must deeply understand what makes an ad convert in 2026.



Crucial Requirement: We are looking for someone who has proven experience working with ecom brands or large-scale fashion dropshippers (e.g., accounts doing €200k+ per month). Experience  is a must, we will pay you accordingly based on your experience.



Key Responsibilities



Static Ads (Main Focus)

Conversion Design: Create high-performing static ads for Meta 
 & Instagram).

Copy & Visuals: Develop hooks, headlines, and primary text variations that work in synergy with the visual.

Messaging: Translate marketing angles into clear, compelling visual messaging that stops the scroll.

Performance Design: Design ads that are built to convert, not just to look "nice."



Creative Strategy



Research: Analyze competitors, winning angles, and the latest fashion trends.

Psychology: Understand awareness levels, market sophistication, and objection handling.

Concepting: Turn market insights into testable, scalable creative concepts.

Testing & Optimization

Data Analysis: Work closely with the media buying team to analyze performance (CTR, Hook Rate, CPA).

Iteration: Improve and iterate on creatives based on hard data, not opinions.

Video (Secondary)

Occasionally assist with UGC-style ad concepts or short-form VSL outlines (rare, but a plus).



Requirements



Proven Track Record: Extensive experience creating static ads for Meta in the fashion niche.

Scale Experience: You have worked with brands or dropshippers operating at a high scale (proven experience with large monthly revenues).

Direct Response Mastery: Strong understanding of hooks, angles, and "Big Ideas."

Copywriting: Strong English copy skills for headlines and short-form ad text.



What We Offer

Long-term Collaboration: This is not a one-off gig.

Growth Path: Starting with approximately 4 hours per week, with the clear intention to scale up to fulltime as we grow.

Structured Environment: Clear direction and a professional testing approach.

Lead Potential: Opportunity to grow into a Lead Creative role.

Competitive Pay: Based on your experience and performance.



How to Apply

Applications without static ad examples will not be considered.



Please include:

A short introduction about yourself.

Portfolio: Examples of static ads you’ve created for fashion (required).

Proof of Scale: Briefly explain your experience with fashion brands/dropshippers doing high-volume (e.g., €200k+/month).

Performance: Any available results (CTR, ROAS, CPA).

title: Trend Hunter For 1.8M Subscriber Channel
description:
**Trend Hunter for 1.8M Subscriber Channel**



We run a large YouTube channel (1.8M+ subscribers) focused on men’s self-improvement, looksmaxxing, fitness, culture, and modern masculinity.

We’re hiring a "Trend Hunter" whose sole job is to find the most viral, controversial, and discussion-worthy content on the internet for us to react to and film about.



If you live online and are always 2–3 days ahead of what everyone else is talking about, this is for you.



Your job:



Your primary responsibility is simple:



Find the 3 most viral/controversial stories or posts every day (or several times per week) in:



* Looksmaxxing

* Fitness/aesthetics

* Dating/manosphere culture

* Male self-improvement

* Internet masculinity discourse



These will be used as source material for YouTube videos and reactions.



What you’ll be doing:



* Scanning
/X, Reddit, TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, and forums daily

* Identifying viral or emerging debates before they go mainstream

* Sending curated story briefs with links, screenshots, and context

* Flagging content with high reaction potential (controversial, funny, insane, insightful, etc.)

* Suggesting video angles/titles when obvious

* Staying deeply tapped into internet culture and male self-improvement spaces



You are perfect for this if you:



* Are extremely online 
/X, Reddit, TikTok, YouTube daily)

* Naturally notice drama, trends, and viral discourse early

* Understand looksmaxxing/manosphere/fitness culture deeply

* Know what makes content go viral

* Have strong intuition for what would make a great reaction video

* Are organized and responsive

* Can send clean, concise daily/weekly reports



Bonus points:



* Experience working with creators or media brands

* Good sense of humor

* Understand YouTube titles/thumbnails

* Familiar with online male self-improvement communities

* Have predicted trends before they blew up



### **Example of what we want from you**



Each day (or agreed schedule), send something like:



**1. Viral topic/story**

Link: 

What’s happening: 5 of the biggest lookmaxxing and manosphere guys went to a club and a controversial song by Ye was played. 

Why it’s blowing up: This caused a huge controversy and many big creators are reacting to it.

Why our audience will care: It is a very viral moment and many of the biggest characters in our niche are involved







Position details:



* Remote

* Flexible hours (as long as you’re online daily)

* Ongoing role if strong fit

* Pay depends on experience



To apply:



Send:



1. Why you’d be good at this job

2. Your favorite YouTube channels/creators

3. 3 current viral or controversial topics in looksmaxxing, fitness, or manosphere right now (with links)



This last part is the real test.

description:
About Us:



Apex Talent Group is a fast-growing influencer marketing agency representing top creators in the tech and lifestyle space. 



Why This Role Exists:



We are looking for a driven, detail-oriented Influencer Outreach Specialist to solve our primary bottleneck: finding and qualifying high-quality influencers at scale. Your job is to own the top of our talent funnel, ensuring we consistently have a pipeline of A-player creators ready for brand campaigns. This is a long-term growth role for someone who wants to become a core part of a high-performance team.



Weekly Deliverables:



This role is measured by your output. Your success will be determined by your ability to consistently deliver the following each week:



• Sourcing Influencers across different niches



•
Personalized Outreach
s: You will be responsible for sending highly personalized, research-based outreach
s to influencers across various niches (tech, travel, etc.). Negotiating and maintaining thorough communications.



• Daily CRM Updates: You will be required to update our Close CRM daily with lead status, contact information, and other relevant data points.



Required Skills & Experience:



• Proven Experience in Influencer Outreach: You must have prior experience in influencer outreach, with a portfolio of successful campaigns or a track record of hitting outreach targets.



• CRM Proficiency: You must be comfortable using a CRM (we use Close CRM) to manage leads and track your pipeline.



• Strong Research Skills: You must be able to quickly research and identify key information about influencers and their audience.



• Excellent English Communication: You must have strong written and verbal communication skills.



• Tech-Savvy: You must be proficient with Google Sheets, Gmail, and social media platforms (YouTube, TikTok, Instagram).



Compensation:



• Base Salary: $300-$500 USD per month.



Schedule & Timezone:



• Hours: 4 hours per day, 5-6 days per week.



• Timezone: Flexible.



Growth Path:



This is a long-term role with the opportunity to grow into a full-time Operations or Talent Management position based on your performance.



Our Hiring Process:



We follow a 7-stage hiring funnel to ensure we only hire the best. This process is designed to be fast, efficient, and fair. It includes:



How to Apply:



To apply, please submit the following:



1. Your resume.



2. A brief explanation of your experience with influencer outreach, including any specific metrics or results you can share.



3. A link to a Google Sheet/document showing how you would send a personalised cold
 to 3-5 tech creators.

title: Construction Accounting
description:
We’re hiring a Project Accountant to support construction, loan, and compliance operations across multiple affordable housing developments. If you’re detail-driven, good with documentation, and like work that has real impact, this is a strong long-term fit.



Why You’ll Love This Role



You will work directly with decision-makers — your work will be visible and valued.

You will help keep projects compliant, funded, and on schedule.

No bureaucracy, no busywork — your work directly moves projects forward.

Real room to grow into senior financial coordination or project support.



Your Typical Day

Organize and maintain project financial and compliance documentation.

Support the preparation of monthly construction draw requests.

Communicate with contractors to collect invoices, lien waivers, and documents.

Update budgets, change order logs, and payment tracking sheets.

Coordinate with lenders, accounting, and project managers as needed.



What You’ll Be Doing



1) Loan & Draw Support

Compile lien waivers, invoices, schedules, and supporting docs for draw packages.

Compare cost reports to contracts, change orders, and lender requirements.

Track soft costs (architect, engineering, inspections, interest, title, etc.).

Prepare clear, organized submission files for lenders.



2) Construction Financial Administration

Maintain digital project files (contracts, pay apps, insurance, permits, payrolls).

Track executed change orders against pay apps and budgets.

Monitor buyout logs, completion schedules, and compliance documents.

Follow up with contractors until documentation is accurate and complete.



3) General Coordination & Reporting

Maintain trackers, logs, and internal reports.

Prepare agendas, notes, and status reports for project meetings.

Communicate professionally with internal and external stakeholders.

Handle confidential financial data with discretion.



What We’re Looking For

2–4+ years in project accounting, construction admin, or loan/draw processing.

Familiarity with construction draws, budgets, or lender compliance preferred.

Proficiency in Excel and document management tools (Procore/Built/Buildertrend a bonus).

Extremely organized, detail-accurate, and accountable to deadlines.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Experience working for a US construction company or real-estate developer



Nice to Have

Experience in real estate development or affordable housing.

Knowledge of construction accounting.

Experience with billing using AIA G702/G703 forms.

Degree in Accounting, Construction Mgmt, Business, or related field.



TO APPLY: send a recording via 
 and answer these questions:

1.) What struck your interest about the role?

2.) Tell me about your experience in construction accounting?



SUBJECT: Construction Accounting - YOUR NAME



About Us



Atrium Housing is a mission-driven affordable housing developer with an affiliated construction company with offices in Louisiana, Florida and Texas. We don’t just build buildings — we create opportunities for families and communities. Our finance and construction teams work with lenders, contractors, and public partners to move projects from concept to completion.

title: YouTube Thumbnail Designer
description:
We are looking for a consistent, long-term thumbnail designer who will conduct topic research  and make YouTube thumbnails.



We run multiple faceless YouTube channels that need consistent thumbnails. This role is less about making "cool/pretty" designs and more about the psychology behind making people click on our videos.



This is a long-term position requiring about 20-30 hours per week (Flexible hours), and making 40-100 thumbnails a week using AI tools and Canva to speed up the process. The job pays $2 per hour with a pay increase based on performance.



Responsibilities



1. Research: You must regularly conduct research on YouTube topics to come up with titles and thumbnails.

2. Thumbnail Design: Make thumbnails using images from the web, AI image tools, and Canva, focusing on layout and composition. We are NOT just looking for pretty images.

3. Titles: Come up with compelling titles based on your research and our guidelines.



Requirements:



1. Experience driving views to YouTube videos with your thumbnail designs.

2. Understand what makes people click on a video.

3. Familiarity with tools like Canva and prompting AI image generators.

Complete a test task.



Pay:



1. $2 USD per hour

2. Paid on the 1st and 15th of every month

3. Must have a Payoneer

4. 20 hours a week, but Flexible hours (Work on your own time)



If you’re passionate about creating work that drives results and want consistent work long-term, reply now! Tell us why you’re the perfect fit for this role. We will send you the application form with the test task to apply. Use "TTND25" as the subject of your message so we know you’re a serious candidate.

title: Amazon Sourcing Specialist
description:
We’re seeking a detail-oriented and cost-conscious Purchasing/Sourcing Specialist to manage and optimize supplier relationships for our Amazon private-label and marketplace operations. You will lead supplier sourcing and negotiation, build landed cost models, and manage execution across samples, POs, freight, and replenishment. The ideal candidate combines sharp cost analysis with operational rigor — ensuring supply chain flows smoothly to FBA/3PL while hitting margin and targets.



Responsibilities:



Source, vet, and onboard manufacturers; run RFQs and negotiate pricing, MOQ, lead times, and payment terms

Build and maintain accurate landed cost models, factoring in duties, freight, and FBA fees to achieve margin goals

Coordinate product samples, specs, labeling, packaging, and regulatory compliance for Amazon and category standards

Create and track POs from production through delivery; ensure on-time, in-full (OTIF) performance from suppliers and carriers

Track vendor performance on cost, quality, lead time, and defect rate; lead corrective actions as needed

Conduct supplier audits and risk assessments, including geopolitical, compliance, and capacity considerations

Drive cost-saving initiatives through negotiation, packaging optimization, freight consolidation, or alternate sourcing

Support continuous improvement in sourcing processes and supplier performance



Requirements:



3+ years in purchasing, sourcing, or supply chain — ideally for Amazon FBA or e-commerce businesses

Proven experience negotiating with overseas factories, including MOQs, pricing, and payment terms

Solid understanding of landed cost analysis, profit margins, and Amazon’s fee structures

Working knowledge of quality control checkpoints and regulatory product compliance

Advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with PO systems

Strong organization, documentation, and multi-SKU project management ability

Proactive problem-solver who can work autonomously in a fast-paced, remote environment

Familiarity with sourcing and market tools like Helium 10 or Keepa is preferred

Experience with EDI, inventory planning, or demand forecasting is preferred

Category experience in regulated goods such as home improvement products or replacement parts is a plus

Exposure to total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis in sourcing decisions is a plus

title: Amazon Catalog Manager
description:
Job Summary:



We’re seeking an experienced Amazon Catalog Manager to own end-to-end listing health and performance for a large SKU portfolio. You’ll manage backend attributes and compliance, optimize front-end content, and analyze key metrics to improve rankings, conversion, and revenue. Ideal for a data-driven operator with deep Seller Central expertise and a track record scaling large catalogs.



Responsibilities:



Catalog Management



Maintain and optimize 500+ SKUs in Seller Central, ensuring accurate categories, browse nodes, variations, and buy box–relevant settings.



Execute monthly content audits (titles, bullets, images, A+), fix suppressions/stranded inventory, and uphold Amazon TOS and compliance.



Manage backend attributes (search terms, item type keywords, intended use, target audience) and ensure listing data integrity.



Sales & Ranking Optimization



Track keyword rankings, CVR, pricing, and subcategory BSR; set weekly sales targets and target BSR per ASIN.



Identify underperforming listings and implement remediation plans (content, offers, pricing/ coupons, deals, images, reviews strategy inputs).



Monitor profitability and contribution margins, coordinating with ads and pricing to hit goals.



Insights & Collaboration



Partner with internal teams on pricing, promotions, creative, and inventory to align levers with growth targets.



Run competitive audits (content, offers, reviews, price moves) and recommend tactical adjustments.



Build and deliver actionable, data-driven performance reports and dashboards.



Requirements:



4+ years hands-on experience in Amazon Seller Central (required).



Proven success managing large catalogs (500+ SKUs) with complex variations.



Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (lookups, pivots, data cleaning).



Expert knowledge of listing optimization, keyword research/strategy, and backend attributes.



Strong grasp of Amazon TOS, compliance, suppressions, and listing health mechanics.



Familiarity with Sellerboard, Keepa, DataRova (or similar) is a plus.



Fluent English; highly organized, analytical, and self-directed.



Committed to a single full-time role.

nts

Test multiple hooks, angles, and storytelling structures per concept and iterate rapidly based on results

Track and analyze content performance including views, engagement, saves, CTR, and conversions

Partner with growth and paid teams to identify high-performing organic content for amplification

Collaborate with influencer, affiliate, creative, and brand teams to ensure consistency in voice, tone, and visual identity

1–2+ years of experience creating and/or strategizing TikTok content for a brand or creator account

Data-informed creative mindset with a focus on performance over vanity metrics

Up-to-date with digital trends, cultural 
nts, and evolving consumer behavior

Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, remote work environment.

title: Executive Assistant / EA
description:
Position: Executive Assistant

Location: Remote (Must be available during Eastern Standard Time - EST)

Type: Full-Time



About Us:



Blakely Brown is seeking a dedicated and professional individual to join our team as an Executive Assistant to our Founder. This role is pivotal in ensuring smooth and efficient communication with our clients from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM EST and managing complex scheduling requirements.



Key Responsibilities:



Outreach Campaigns: Coordinating with the team to successfully launch outreach campaigns and handling responses.

Calendar Management: Efficiently manage and organize the executive's calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

Client Communication: Serve as the first point of contact for clients, handling correspondence and communications with professionalism and discretion.

Administrative Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support to the executive team, including document preparation, managing
s, and coordinating events.

Project Coordination: Assist with project management tasks, ensuring deadlines are met and stakeholders are informed of progress.

Confidentiality: Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and discretion with sensitive company and client information.



Requirements:



Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar administrative support role.

Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate directly with clients and team members.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and virtual meeting platforms (Zoom, Google Meet).

Ability to work independently and in a remote setting, has previously worked EST and available during Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.

A proactive approach to problem-solving and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.



Benefits:

Competitive salary with 13th Month Pay (600 GBP starting rate)

12 paid vacation leave per year and some public holidays in the Philippines are observed

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Supportive and collaborative work environment.



How to Apply:

Please send your resume and cover letter to 
 with the subject line "Your Executive Assistant" and add your favorite color. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Experienced Booker / Sales Representative
description:
We’re looking for an experienced booker or salesperson who is confident, organised, and comfortable having real conversations (not someone who relies heavily on scripts).



ABOUT US:



We are a mobile massage therapy business, providing professional massage services directly to clients in their homes, workplaces, and events. We focus on quality, trust, and genuine human connection, and we’re growing - which is why we’re looking for someone who can confidently represent our brand on the phone.



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:



Proven experience in sales or booking roles

High level of English (spoken and written)

Strong communication skills and confidence on calls

Organised, reliable, and able to manage follow-ups

Able to ad-lib naturally and sound human (not robotic or overly scripted)



ROLE DETAILS:



Expected calls: 50 calls per week

Working hours: 40 hours per month (approx. 8–10 hours per week)

£200 per month

Payable via Wise

, please include:

This helps us assess your communication style, confidence, and ability to think on the spot.



If you’re confident on the phone, enjoy sales conversations, and want a flexible remote role with a growing wellness business, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Trial Reel Account Manager (Instagram Posting & Analytics) – Female Only
description:
As a Trial Reel Account Manager at SimplexMedia, you will be responsible for high-volume scheduling and posting of content on Instagram, specifically for trial reel-only clients. This role requires someone who is highly organised, detail-oriented, and comfortable working at speed while maintaining accuracy.



You will manage mass posting (up to 8 posts per client per day) and support the team by helping track and interpret basic performance analytics.



Please note: this role is execution and analytics-focused and does not involve content strategy or content creation.



RESPONSIBILITIES



Posting & Account Management (Instagram)



Schedule and publish high-volume Instagram content (up to 8 posts per client daily)



Ensure all posts are uploaded accurately, on time, and in the correct format



Follow Instagram optimisation processes when setting up and managing accounts



Monitor trial accounts daily to ensure posting consistency and performance



Quality Assurance

Are Instagram accounts set up correctly?

Help identify trends in engagement and reel performance



Assist in compiling simple analytics reports for internal review



Administration & Communication

Maintain clear communication with the team via Slack and



Stay on top of assigned administrative tasks and deadlines

RESULTS

All trial clients receive their full daily posting volume



Performance data is properly tracked and available for review



Issues are communicated early and resolved efficiently



All tasks are documented and updated daily in Notion

title: Game Artist / Game Designer
description:
Position Overview



We’re looking for a creative Game Artist / Game Designer to join our team on a gig or part-time basis. You will work closely with our product, marketing, and game development teams to create high-quality visual assets that support our gaming ecosystem.



We strongly prefer candidates with experience creating slot game artwork, game environments, characters, symbols, UI elements, or promotional game assets, but this role is not limited to slot games. Experience in other game genres is also welcome.



Responsibilities



• Create game art assets such as symbols, backgrounds, characters, and UI elements

• Design visual themes and styles that fit different game concepts

• Collaborate with developers and designers to translate ideas into polished visuals

• Design UI elements for games when needed (menus, buttons, layouts)

• Ensure consistency in style, color, and overall visual direction

• Prepare assets optimized for implementation in games

• Iterate on artwork based on feedback and gameplay requirements

• Maintain organized working files and follow versioning best practices



Requirements



• Proven experience as a game artist, digital artist, or similar role

• Portfolio must include game-related work (slot game art, game UI, characters, environments, or similar)

• Strong skills in tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar design software

• Solid understanding of composition, color, and visual hierarchy

• Attention to detail and consistency across assets

• Fluent in written and spoken English for clear remote communication

• Self-driven and able to deliver with minimal supervision

• Must be able to work, or significantly overlap, with CET (Central European Time) hours



Bonus Skills



• Previous experience creating slot game art or casino-style game assets

• Familiarity with Web3, gaming, or crypto-related visuals

• Experience using AI tools for concept generation or iteration



Location:

- Remote role open to candidates based in the Philippines, with availability during CET hours.



Schedule:

- Gig or part-time. Flexible hours based on project needs and deadlines.



How to Apply (Any submission that fails to follow instructions will be declined.)



Please include:

• Your resume

• Portfolio (required) showcasing relevant game art or design work

• Your
 or Teams ID for contact

• Your
 Full Name at the end of the proposal (Required to process the application)
