title: Senior Blockchain & Trading Systems Engineer (Web Platform)
description:
Project Overview



We are building a web-based crypto trading signal platform that delivers real-time trading signals to users. The system currently exists as a Windows desktop application, and the goal is to re-architect and migrate it into a scalable, secure, and high-performance web application.



The platform processes live market data, applies trading logic and indicators, and distributes actionable signals with low latency to traders operating across multiple exchanges.



Key Responsibilities



Design and develop a web-based trading application that mirrors and extends the functionality of the existing Windows trading system



Implement real-time data pipelines for crypto market data (price feeds, order books, indicators, volume, volatility)



Build and optimize signal generation engines for crypto trading strategies



Develop low-latency communication layers using WebSockets, streaming APIs, or message queues



Integrate with centralized and decentralized crypto exchanges (REST / WebSocket APIs)



Architect scalable backend services capable of handling high-frequency market updates



Ensure data integrity, fault tolerance, and high availability for live trading signals



Implement authentication, authorization, and role-based access control for users



Apply security best practices for crypto-related systems (API key handling, encryption, rate limiting)



Collaborate on system design for future automation, including bot execution and portfolio tracking



Required Technical Skills



Core Technologies



Strong experience with web application development (React, Next.js, or similar frameworks)



Backend expertise with Node.js, Python, or similar high-performance server runtimes



Real-time communication using WebSockets, SSE, or streaming protocols



Blockchain & Trading



Solid understanding of cryptocurrency markets, trading mechanics, and market structure



Experience working with crypto exchange APIs (spot, futures, derivatives)



Knowledge of trading indicators, strategies, and signal processing



Familiarity with blockchain fundamentals (transactions, blocks, confirmations, gas, smart contracts)



Understanding of latency-sensitive systems and event-driven architectures



Infrastructure & Data



Experience with high-frequency data ingestion and processing



Databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, or time-series databases



Cloud deployment using AWS, GCP, or Azure



Containerization with Docker and orchestration basics (optional Kubernetes)



Preferred / Bonus Skills



Experience with automated trading bots or execution engines



Knowledge of DeFi protocols, on-chain data indexing, or Web3 integrations



Familiarity with risk management systems and position sizing logic



Experience migrating desktop applications to web platforms



Background in financial systems, fintech, or algorithmic trading



Project Goals



Convert an existing Windows-based trading system into a modern web platform



Deliver real-time, accurate, and reliable crypto trading signals



Build a foundation for scalable growth, future mobile apps, and automated trading features



Ideal Candidate Profile



Strong engineering mindset with attention to performance, reliability, and security



Comfortable working with real-time financial data and trading systems



Able to translate existing desktop logic into web-first, cloud-native architecture



Passionate about blockchain, crypto markets, and trading technology

title: Operations Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Accounting Manager to lead our accounting department. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned professional with a strong background in financial management and a proven track record of leading high-performing teams. The Accounting Manager will be responsible for all accounting operations, including financial reporting, internal controls, and budget management, ensuring the financial health and integrity of our company.



Responsibilities:



- Direct all aspects of accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, and general ledger.

- Manage the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.

- Develop and maintain internal controls and accounting policies.

- Oversee the annual budgeting and forecasting processes.

- Lead and mentor the accounting team, fostering professional growth.

- Liaise with external auditors and manage the audit process.

- Provide strategic financial guidance to senior management.

- Ensure all full-cycle accounting activities are accurate and complete.

- Lead the new client onboarding process and manage client relationships.

- Compile and analyze financial information to prepare general ledger entries and document business transactions.

- Ensure the team meets all project and task deadlines.



Qualifications:



- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance. Master’s degree or CPA is preferred.

- 7+ years of accounting experience, with at least 3 years in a management role.

- Deep expertise in GAAP, financial analysis, and reporting.

- Strong leadership and people management skills.

- Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities.

- Advanced proficiency in financial software and ERP systems.

title: Assistant Accountant
description:
Assistant Accountant



Position Title: Assistant Accountant

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Employment Type: Full-time



Role Purpose



The Assistant Accountant provides day-to-day accounting, bookkeeping, and payroll support to ensure accurate financial records, timely reporting, and compliance with statutory requirements. This role works closely with the Accountant and Property Manager to support operational, payroll, and reporting needs across the business.



Key Objectives



Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records



Support timely payroll processing and statutory submissions



Assist with monthly and year-end close processes



Provide reliable financial and payroll reporting



Support the Accountant and Property Manager with operational finance tasks



Key Responsibilities

1. Bookkeeping & Reconciliations



Perform regular bookkeeping tasks including recording invoices, bills, and expenses



Complete regular bank reconciliations to ensure accuracy of accounts



Assist in managing accounts payable and accounts receivable



2. Payroll & Rostering Support



Assist in preparing and managing staff rosters



Set up and prepare payroll runs using QBO, MYOB, or Xero on a weekly or fortnightly basis



Prepare Single Touch Payroll (STP) data and payroll-related records



Assist with superannuation and payroll tax preparation for lodgement



3. Statutory & Compliance Support



Prepare monthly IAS and quarterly BAS



Assist with Long Service Leave (LSL) lodgements and payroll tax submissions



Ensure payroll and statutory records are accurate and compliant



4. Reporting & Close Processes



Support month-end and year-end close processes



Prepare regular financial reports including:



Payroll analysis



Monthly Profit & Loss reports



Other reports as required by management



5. General Accounting & Property Support



Provide accounting support to the Accountant and Property Manager



Assist with ad-hoc accounting, finance, and property-related tasks as required



Key Relationships



Accountant (Direct Reporting)



Property Manager (Direct Reporting)



Internal finance and operations teams



External stakeholders as required



Skills & Experience



Essential



Experience in bookkeeping, accounting support, or assistant accountant roles



Working knowledge of QBO, MYOB, and/or Xero



Understanding of payroll processing, BAS, IAS, and bank reconciliations



High attention to detail and strong numerical accuracy



Ability to manage recurring tasks and deadlines



Strong written and verbal English communication skills



Highly Regarded



Experience working with Australian businesses or accounting firms



Exposure to payroll compliance and statutory reporting



Experience supporting property-related financial processes



Remote work experience



Key Competencies



Highly organised and detail-oriented



Reliable, proactive, and deadline-driven



Strong sense of ownership and accountability



Comfortable working with structured processes



Clear and professional communicator



KPIs & Performance Measures



Accuracy of bookkeeping and reconciliations



Timeliness of payroll and statutory submissions



Quality and reliability of financial reports



Effectiveness of support to Accountant and Property Manager



Responsiveness and consistency in task completion



Work Schedule



Monday to Friday



Fixed schedule aligned with Australian business hours



Weekends off



Compensation & Benefits



Salary: Based on qualifications, experience, and interview



Leave credits after regularization



Fixed working hours with strong work–life balance



Opportunities for professional growth and career progression

title: Team Lead, Manager, Head of Customer Service
description:
About the Role

As Head of Customer Service, you'll own end-to-end customer support for our 6 international Shopify-powered websites. You'll lead a talented, distributed team while partnering closely with operations to ensure seamless order fulfilment and lightning-fast resolution of last-mile challenges. This is a strategic leadership role with real impact—turning every customer interaction into a brand-strengthening 
nt.



Please review JD below and apply via the link if you have relevant experience:





Key Responsibilities:

• Lead, mentor, and develop a remote team of 3–4 Customer Service Agents across the Philippines and Poland, fostering a collaborative, high-trust culture.

• Oversee daily operations in Gorgias (our unified helpdesk integrated with Shopify), ensuring excellent KPIs: CSAT >90%, fast first-response times, high resolution rates, and low escalation volumes.

• Manage support for 6 distinct websites (UK, Poland, Australia-focused), handling multi-currency, multi-language (English primary + Polish support), and region-specific consumer expectations/compliance (UK Consumer Rights, Australian Consumer Law, GDPR elements).

• Collaborate daily with the Operations team to monitor on-time fulfillment, proactively address shipping delays, last-mile carrier issues (tracking exceptions, damages, customs), and reduce ops-related tickets through root-cause fixes and process improvements.

• Build and optimize automations, rules, macros, AI Agent usage, and custom Views in Gorgias to scale efficiency for a small team.

• Drive proactive customer communications (e.g., delay updates) and implement knowledge base improvements to empower agents and self-service.

• Analyze trends via Gorgias/Shopify reports; deliver monthly insights to leadership on customer pain points, delivery performance, and opportunities to enhance the brand experience.

• Ensure consistent brand voice, tone, and quality across all touchpoints while adapting to cultural nuances in UK, EU/Poland, and Australian markets.

• Champion continuous improvement—testing new tools, workflows, and training to handle growth in ticket volume and complexity.

What We're Looking For

• 7+ years in customer service leadership, with at least 3–5 years in e-commerce / Shopify environments (multi-store experience highly valued).

• Proven hands-on expertise with Gorgias (multi-brand/store setups, automations, AI features, Views, rules) and Shopify order/fulfillment tools.

• Experience bridging Customer Service + Operations—resolving fulfillment/last-mile issues, reducing repeat tickets, and collaborating cross-functionally.

• Strong remote leadership skills: managing distributed teams across time zones (PH + Poland), async communication, motivation, and performance coaching.

• International mindset: Comfortable with UK/EU/AU markets, time-zone coordination, and cultural sensitivity.

• Data-driven: Skilled at using reports/dashboards to spot trends and drive decisions.

• Excellent English communication (written/verbal); Polish fluency a strong plus.

• Proactive, solutions-oriented, calm under pressure, with a passion for premium fashion brands and delivering wow-level service.

Why Join us?

• Be part of a dynamic, privately owned global business with iconic brands and ambitious growth—especially in the exciting APAC expansion.

• Remote flexibility from the Philippines with competitive 

• Opportunity to shape customer experience for premium fashion across continents—your work directly impacts brand reputation and loyalty.

• Collaborative, agile culture: Work with passionate teams in London, Sydney, and worldwide partners.

• Career growth: As we scale e-commerce and enter new markets, high performers have real paths to broader leadership roles.

• Make a difference: Help deliver exceptional service that turns customers into lifelong fans of our heritage and sports brands.

If you're a customer-obsessed leader who thrives in fast-paced e-commerce, loves solving complex multi-market challenges, and wants to build something special with a portfolio of world-class brands—we want to hear from you.

title: Senior Frontend Game & Blockchain Engineer (Web3 Puzzle Platform)
description:
Project Overview



We are enhancing an existing image-based puzzle application by significantly upgrading its visual animations, rendering performance, and interactive effects, while also integrating blockchain-based features to enable digital ownership, rewards, and on-chain interactions.



The project combines high-performance 2D rendering (game-engine style) with Web3 infrastructure, creating a modern, visually engaging puzzle platform that bridges casual gaming and blockchain technology.



Key Responsibilities



Game & Animation Development



Redesign and implement high-performance animations and visual effects for an image puzzle game



Migrate or enhance rendering using Pixi.js, Phaser.js, or comparable 2D rendering frameworks



Optimize render loops, asset loading, and memory usage for smooth gameplay across devices



Implement advanced effects such as transitions, particle systems, shader-based effects, and dynamic lighting



Ensure responsive interaction handling (drag, snap, inertia, zoom, touch support)



Blockchain & Web3 Integration



Design and integrate blockchain-based features into the puzzle platform



Implement wallet connectivity (e.g., MetaMask or WalletConnect)



Develop smart contract interactions for game logic, rewards, or asset ownership



Enable NFT-based puzzle assets, achievements, or collectible items



Integrate on-chain/off-chain synchronization between gameplay state and blockchain data



Apply security best practices for Web3 applications



Platform & Architecture



Collaborate on the overall web architecture to combine real-time rendering with Web3 services



Integrate backend services for user profiles, progress tracking, and metadata storage



Ensure scalability and maintainability for future content, modes, and monetization features



Required Technical Skills



Frontend & Rendering



Strong JavaScript / TypeScript expertise



Hands-on experience with Pixi.js, Phaser.js, or similar rendering/game frameworks



Deep understanding of canvas, WebGL, rendering pipelines, and animation loops



Experience optimizing FPS, draw calls, textures, and asset pipelines



Blockchain & Web3



Solid understanding of blockchain fundamentals (transactions, wallets, gas, confirmations)



Experience integrating Web3 libraries (ethers.js, web3.js, or similar)



Familiarity with smart contracts (Solidity or equivalent)



Understanding of NFT standards and token-based systems



General Web Stack



Experience with modern frontend frameworks (React, Next.js, or similar)



API integration (REST / GraphQL)



Version control with Git and collaborative workflows



Preferred / Bonus Skills



Experience building browser-based games or interactive applications



Knowledge of game physics, easing functions, and animation curves



Familiarity with DeFi, tokenomics, or on-chain reward systems



Experience with cross-platform optimization (desktop, mobile, tablet)



UI/UX sensitivity for game feel and player engagement



Project Goals



Modernize the puzzle app with smooth, engaging, game-quality animations



Introduce blockchain-enabled ownership and reward mechanics



Build a scalable foundation for future game modes, tournaments, and digital assets



Ideal Candidate Profile



Strong frontend engineer with game development instincts



Comfortable balancing performance-critical rendering with Web3 logic



Passionate about interactive design, animation, and blockchain gaming



Able to evolve an existing product into a polished Web3-enabled experience

title: Zapier Automation Specialist (Freelance / Part-Time
description:
We are a fast-growing UK e-commerce company looking for an experienced freelance Zapier specialist to help automate processes across our business.



Your role will be to design, build, and maintain Zapier workflows that connect our core systems (Google Sheets, Gmail, Slack, Amazon tools, customer service platforms, etc.) to remove manual work and improve efficiency.



**Key Responsibilities:**



* Build and optimise Zapier automations (“Zaps”) across multiple apps

* Create workflows for reporting, alerts, customer service, and operations

* Map and clean data between platforms

* Troubleshoot and fix broken automations

* Improve existing processes to reduce Zapier task usage

* Document workflows clearly for internal use



**Requirements:**



* Strong hands-on experience with Zapier (essential)

* Experience with Google Sheets, Gmail, Slack, and business tools

* Ability to build multi-step workflows with filters, formatting, and logic

* Good problem-solving and analytical skills

* Reliable, organised, and detail-oriented

* Good written English



**Nice to Have:**



* Experience with Amazon Seller Central / e-commerce businesses

* Knowledge of APIs, webhooks, or Make.com

* Experience connecting Zapier to BigQuery or reporting tools



**Hours & Setup:**



* Flexible freelance / part-time

* Project-based or ongoing support

* Fully remote



---



**Screening Questions (REQUIRED – applications without answers will be ignored):**



Please answer the following in detail:

1. How many years of experience do you have using Zapier, and approximately how many Zaps have you built?

2. Describe 3 real Zapier workflows you have built in previous roles.

   * What problem were you solving?

   * Which apps were connected?

   * What logic or filters did you use?

5. What apps have you connected Zapier to?

6. What is your hourly rate and typical availability per week?

7. When could you start?



---

Please apply with your answers above, plus any portfolio examples or screenshots of automations you have built.



We are looking for someone who can start quickly and help us build practical automations that deliver real business value.

title: React Native Developer
description:
We are building a modern, enterprise-grade restaurant Point of Sale (POS) system from the ground up. Our platform runs on Android tablets (React Native/Expo) and includes a web-based admin dashboard (Next.js). We're looking for a skilled React Native developer to join our core team.

What you'll work on:



Building tablet-based POS screens: order management, table management, payment processing

Implementing offline-first architecture so the app works without internet

Integrating with payment terminals and receipt printers

Real-time data synchronization with our Supabase backend

Creating smooth, responsive UI with 60fps animations optimized for touch



Requirements:



2+ years experience with React Native and Expo

Strong TypeScript skills

Experience with Zustand, TanStack Query, or similar state management libraries

Comfortable styling with NativeWind or Tailwind CSS

Understanding of offline data persistence and sync patterns

Reliable internet and able to overlap with US Eastern time zone for team meetings



Nice to have:



Experience building POS, fintech, or restaurant technology

Supabase or PostgreSQL experience

Android hardware integration (Intents, SDKs)

Familiarity with Clerk authentication



This role is a great fit if you:



Want to build a product from scratch, not just maintain existing code

Enjoy solving real-world problems (offline reliability, hardware integration)

Take ownership and communicate proactively

title: Creative Strategist
description:
We’re a fast-growing $20 M/year health and wellness brand looking to develop a bench of smart, hungry creatives who can crank out high-impact ad concepts and short-form copy. If you’ve got solid fundamentals, an eye for what converts, and you love turning ideas into thumb-stopping creative, we’ll give you the systems, mentorship, and runway to level up quickly.



What You’ll Do

• Concept & Copy: Generate punchy headlines, hooks, and 1-2 minute ad scripts for
, TikTok and YouTube.

• Creative Strategy: Deconstruct winning ads (our own + market leaders) and pitch fresh angles, formats, and storyboards.

• Research & Swipe-Building: Maintain a living swipe file of best-in-class health ads, landing pages, and content trends.

• Iterate & Test: Turn performance data into rapid creative tweaks—new hooks, lead lines, CTAs, offers.

• Cross-Team Collab: Work closely with media buyers, designers, and senior copywriters to ship 10+ new ads per week.



Must-Have Traits

• Low Ego, High Curiosity: Be ready to learn, take feedback and chase what works, not artistic credit.

• Outcome-Focused: You care about ad performance ROAS more than volume.

• System-Friendly: You can learn our proven frameworks and still inject your own style.

• Self-Directed: Comfortable working remotely, hitting deadlines, and asking smart questions.

• Detail Sharpness: Typos, compliance flags, and fuzzy claims bother you.



Nice-to-Have Skills

• Ad spy tools (AdLibrary, Foreplay, Minea etc.)

• Familiarity with VSL/VLR, RMBC, or other direct-response frameworks

• Personal interest in health, wellness, or supplements

• Bonus points for including your favorite color somewhere in the application



What We Offer

• Fully Remote, Full-Time role with clear advancement paths

• Hands-On Training in our ad research and creative systems

• Mentorship from seven-figure direct-response copywriters

• Quarterly Performance-Based Raises & Monthly Creative Bonuses

• A tight, no-BS culture that values speed, data, and real results



How to Apply



Please submit your application at zurl.to/OsYu?source=CareerSite and include the following:

1. Portfolio/Examples of your copy (preferably for short form ads).

2. A quick teardown: Paste a link to a health ad you think works and give us a 3-bullet analysis of why.



If you’re ready to grow fast, ship relentless creative, and see your words drive millions in revenue, we want to meet you.

title: Creative YouTube Editor (From Twitch VODs) - Paid Per Video, Long-Term
description:
Kamusta!!

I’m looking for a sharp, independent video editor to turn my Twitch streams into high-retention YouTube videos (roughly 8–15+ minutes).



This is not basic clip cutting.

You’ll review full VODs, identify strong 
nts, and shape them into videos with good pacing and retention.



My content is calm, conversational, and dense (fitness, mindset, lifestyle). I’m looking for someone who understands why a 
nt works; not just how to cut it.



Workflow (Designed to Stay Hands-Off for Me):

 - You pull directly from my Twitch VODs (no files sent)

– You identify 1 strong segment or theme per video

– You send timestamps + a 1-sentence hook for quick approval

– You edit the full video + create a CTR-focused thumbnail

– You send a draft (Drive link); max 1 feedback round

– Final delivery ? I upload

– Target: 1–3 videos per week

As trust builds, approval friction drops. The goal is autonomy.



What You’re Responsible For:

– Watch long VODs (2–4 hours)

– Identify 
nts worth turning into full YouTube videos

– Edit for pacing, structure, and viewer retention

– Create clean, clickable thumbnails

– Work independently and meet deadlines



Requirements:

– Experience editing long-form YouTube videos (Big plus if you have successful work with other YouTubers: share links)

– Understanding of hooks and retention (not just transitions)

– Good English reading comprehension

– Reliable internet + ability to work async

– Tools: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve; Canva or Photoshop



Livestream, gaming, or fitness content experience is a plus.



Pay (Per Video):

• $18–30 USD per long-form YouTube video (8–15 min)

• Paid trial video

• Performance bonuses for strong CTR & retention

• Rates increase with trust, autonomy, and results



Bonuses & Growth:

– Long-term collaboration for editors who show judgment and taste

– Opportunity to expand into lifestyle / IRL content over time

– Potential path to full channel autonomy as output scales



How to Apply (Top Applicants Only):

1. Please share 2–3 links to long-form YouTube videos you've edited.

2. Answer this: “From a 3-hour Twitch VOD, what 
nt would you turn into a YouTube video — and why?”

3. One sentence on why you're the best fit for this role.



Applications without examples or answers will be ignored.

Shortlisted applicants will receive a paid trial video.



Salamat! Usap tayo.

title: VR Developer (Unity & Meta Quest)
description:
VR Developer (Unity & Meta Quest 3) - Full-Time | Remote | AUD $2,000–$2,500



Location: Philippines

Working Hours: Mon–Fri, Western Australian business hours (UTC+8)

Reporting to: Head of XR Development

Works with: Head of Development, Head of 3D Design, 3D Artists, Technical Artists, Project Managers, Animation & Real-Time Leads



Role Overview



3D Walkabout is looking for a Unity VR developer with strong experience building applications for Meta Quest headsets. This role is focused on developing, maintaining, and shipping VR experiences on Quest 2 and Quest 3, primarily using Unity, Meta SDK and OpenXR.



This is a hands-on role suited to someone who is comfortable working close to the hardware, cares about performance, and understands the constraints of standalone VR. You will be working on real client and internal projects, not prototypes that never ship.



What You’ll Be Doing



- Develop VR applications in Unity for Meta Quest 2 and Quest 3

- Implement VR interactions using hand tracking and controllers

- Work with MR features such as passthrough where required

- Optimise scenes for performance, memory, and battery life on standalone headsets

- Integrate UI, interactions, audio, and gameplay systems into production-ready builds

- Collaborate with artists to ensure assets are Quest-ready and performant



Tools & Technologies



Essential



- Unity (C#) with shipped VR projects

- Meta Quest SDK / OpenXR

- XR Interaction Toolkit or custom interaction systems

- Performance optimisation for standalone VR

- Git and collaborative workflows



Preferred



- Hand tracking and mixed reality on Quest

- Shader Graph or lightweight custom shaders

- Unity URP for VR

- Experience profiling with Unity Profiler and Meta tools

- Building APKs and managing Quest deployment pipelines

- Networking / Multiplayer – Photon, Netcode for GameObjects



About You



- 3+ years professional experience with Unity

- Direct experience shipping VR content, ideally on Meta Quest

- Comfortable debugging performance and interaction issues

- Able to work independently and communicate clearly in a remote team

- Detail-oriented and focused on delivering stable, usable builds



Bonus Experience



- Training, simulation, or enterprise VR

- Tooling or editor scripts in Unity

- Networking or data-driven VR applications

- Experience porting projects between platforms



What You’ll Get



- Focused VR work on real projects that ship

- Exposure to Quest-first and MR applications

- Direct collaboration with senior XR and 3D developers

- Opportunity to grow with an established XR studio



About Us



3D Walkabout is an Australian 3D visualisation and XR studio creating immersive content for clients across property, infrastructure, education, and industry. We blend creativity, technology, and storytelling to bring digital environments and products to life through 3D, VR, AR, and interactive experiences.



How to Apply



Send us:



- Your CV or LinkedIn profile

- A portfolio or GitHub showing Unity VR work

- A short note about your experience with Meta Quest or standalone VR

You will work closely with executives, operations, support teams, and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure the business runs efficiently while contributing to strategic initiatives that drive growth and revenue.

Strategic & Analytical Support

Communication & Collaboration

title: NEMT Routing Specialist
description:
Hiring Filipino and Philippine-based professionals only!



Wingz, is a leading US rideshare company focused on Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT). 

Visit our website: 



Job Summary:



The NEMT Routing Specialist plays a critical role in the day-to-day operations of our transportation services. This role involves planning efficient routes, assigning trips to drivers, negotiating trip acceptance, and ensuring schedules run smoothly. Strong presentation and negotiation skills are key to motivating drivers to accept assigned trips and maintaining operational efficiency.



You will work closely with U.S.-based operations staff and drivers to optimize scheduling, improve trip efficiency, and maintain a high standard of service for patients.



 Work Schedule:  US Hours (EST)

 Work Setup:  Remote | Independent Contractor

 Employment Type:  Full-Time | Long-Term Opportunity

 Fixed Salary: USD 900/ Month

 Perks:  10 PTO days + HMO (after probation)

 Payout:  Semi-Monthly

 Equipment:  Self-Provided



Key Responsibilities:



• Plan, schedule, and optimize daily transportation routes for NEMT drivers.

• Assign trips to drivers and ensure acceptance through effective communication, presentation, and negotiation.

• Monitor driver schedules and adjust routes as needed for delays, cancellations, or emergencies.

• Communicate with drivers proactively to resolve concerns, provide support, and encourage timely trip acceptance.

• Ensure all trips comply with NEMT regulatory requirements and company policies.

• Maintain accurate records of trips, drivers, and route changes using company software.

• Collaborate with dispatch, operations, and customer support teams to resolve scheduling conflicts.

• Identify opportunities to improve routing efficiency and reduce operational costs.

• Generate reports on route performance, on-time metrics, and driver engagement.

• Provide insights and recommendations to management to enhance overall transportation operations.



Qualifications:



• At least 2 years of experience in routing, dispatch, logistics coordination, or transportation planning (experience with NEMT or U.S.-based operations is a plus).

• Background in sales, customer service, or client engagement is highly preferred to leverage presentation and negotiation skills with drivers.

• Strong English communication skills (verbal and written).

• Ability to motivate and influence drivers to accept trips while maintaining positive relationships.

• Familiarity with routing and mapping software (e.g., Google Maps, Waze, or route optimization tools).

• Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and time management skills.

• Ability to multitask and manage last-minute changes effectively.

• High attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping.

• Comfortable working with U.S. time zones (EST).

• Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet workspace suitable for remote work.



Preferred Skills (Optional but Advantageous):



• Prior experience in Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT) operations.

• Familiarity with NEMT software platforms.

• Knowledge of U.S. transportation regulations and compliance requirements.

• Experience in data analysis or route optimization strategies.



What We Offer:



• Competitive monthly compensation in USD 

• Performance-based monthly bonus ($
per month)

• Paid training and onboarding

• Long-term and stable remote opportunity

• Opportunity for career growth in operations

title: Data Engineer
description:
Hiring Filipino and Philippine-based professionals only!



Wingz, is a leading US rideshare company focused on Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT). 

Visit our website: 



Position: Data Engineer

Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, (US EST Time)

Employment Set-up: Remote (Independent Contractor)

Salary Range: USD 1,500 - 2,500/ Month

Pay-out Frequency: Semi-Monthly

Benefits: Unlimited PTO and HMO after the probationary period

Equipment: Self-Provided



Job Summary:

The Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining scalable, secure, and reliable data infrastructure that powers analytics, product insights, and operational efficiency at Wingz. This role turns raw data into actionable insights across areas like performance analytics, route optimization, compliance reporting, and driver behavior.

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, highly proficient in SQL, experienced in BI tools (Superset is a plus), and committed to ensuring data quality across development cycles. This role works closely with engineering, QA, product, and business teams to enable data-driven decision-making and maintain a trusted data ecosystem.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Test Design & Execution:

• Develop, execute, and maintain manual and automated test cases, test scripts, and test plans to ensure software quality.

• Identify test scenarios based on software requirements and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.



2. Software Testing:

• Conduct functional, regression, integration, and performance testing to validate software functionality and system performance.

• Assist in verifying software compliance with business requirements, industry standards, and company quality guidelines.



3. Defect Tracking & Issue Resolution:

• Identify, document, and report software defects using issue-tracking tools (e.g., Jira, Trello).

• Work with developers to troubleshoot, reproduce, and resolve issues in test environments.

• Verify bug fixes and updates before production deployment.



4. Automation & Continuous Improvement:

• Contribute to the maintenance and improvement of automated test suites, frameworks, and testing tools to enhance efficiency.

• Identify opportunities to automate repetitive test cases for increased accuracy and speed.



5. Collaboration & Reporting:

• Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and business analysts, to understand project goals and testing needs.

• Analyze and interpret test results, prepare detailed test reports, and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

• Assist in diagnosing and resolving issues reported by users and internal teams.



Qualifications:



• 4+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role, with strong expertise in SQL.

• Proven experience in querying relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.

• Experience with cloud-based databases (e.g., AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Azure SQL Database).

• Knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g., Superset, Looker, Qlik, or Domo).

• Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying, data manipulation, and optimization.

• Strong understanding of database management systems (DBMS) and data warehousing concepts.

• Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools is preferred.

• Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.

• Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.

• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

• Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.

• Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

mbers and stakeholders.

title: ???? We’re Hiring: Operations & Content Virtual Assistant (20 hrs/week)
description:

If you love systems, deadlines, follow-ups, and turning ideas into published work—this is for you.

Hours: 20 hours/week

Style: Outcome-based, deadline-driven, proactive

You will manage and grow the speaking pipeline using an existing Excel tracker.

Build relationships with event planners

Keep tracker fully updated with status

15 new opportunities added

No stalled or incomplete entries

Tracker always current

Podcast Management:

Coordinate guest recording schedules

Write show notes & upload transcripts

Upload episodes to Spotify, YouTube & other platforms

Draft 1–2 launch posts per episode

Upload episodes to website with images, descriptions & transcripts

Publish within 48 hours of receiving final files

Success:

2 LinkedIn business posts weekly

Podcast episode fully published when applicable

All assets uploaded on time



3?? Website & Blog Content Management (10%)

Plan 3 months of content together

Track deadlines & follow up with contributors

Light editing only (grammar/clarity—do not change voice)

Upload posts with images & basic SEO

Schedule publishing

Success:

3 blog posts published monthly

No formatting or publishing errors





4?? Book / Journal Project Support (10%)

Weekly accountability check-ins

Research quotes, references & layout ideas

Canva design (black & white)

Prepare files for Amazon (ebook & hardcover)

Design ebook + hardcover covers

Draft & schedule promo posts (before, during & after launch)

Success:

One tangible deliverable every week

(research, layout, design, or promo content



5?? QuickBooks Setup (5–10%)

Migrate income & expenses from Excel/Word

Set up invoicing

Set up 1099s

Organize expense & receivable tracking

Success (by end of February):

All historical data entered accurately

Invoices & expenses fully functional



6?? Client Onboarding Support (5–10%)

Send assessment codes with instructions (template provided)

Track completion

Consolidate results into Excel for team visibility

Success:

Immediate execution upon request

Accurate tracking

Consistent customer experience



???? Working Style & Expectations

This role requires someone who:

Proactively flags blockers

Speaks up if timelines aren’t realistic

Asks clarifying questions early

Repeats instructions to confirm understanding

Focuses on outcomes, not just tasks

You will be expected to hold contributors accountable and keep projects moving.



? Ideal Candidate



Strong English (written & spoken)

Extremely organized & detail-oriented

Comfortable with Excel trackers & systems

Confident communicating with event planners & partners

Canva + content coordination experience

Podcast or content ops experience is a big plus

QuickBooks experience preferred





???? To Apply:

Send your resume + a short message explaining:

Your experience managing multiple projects

Your experience with content, podcasts, or speaking pipelines

Why you’re a good fit for an outcome-driven role

title: Head of Operations / COO (Execution & Scaling) – Ecommerce
description:
About Us

We run a portfolio of DTC ecommerce stores using a pod-based model. Our edge is speed: we find proven ad creatives, adapt them fast, and scale across multiple products and stores.



We are building toward 10+ pods over time and need a full-time execution leader to run day-to-day operations and make sure the company ships consistently without the founder being the bottleneck.



This is not a fractional, advisory, or consulting role.





What You’ll Own (Day-to-Day)

- Run execution across multiple pods (one pod = one store)

- Lead weekly planning and daily execution cadence

- Enforce accountability, deadlines, and output targets

- Hire, manage, and develop pod owners + execution roles

- Remove bottlenecks across creative production, media buying, CRO, and tech

- Build and enforce SOPs, templates, and operating rhythms

- Performance management (coaching, feedback, replacement when needed)

- Reporting: weekly scorecard and key escalations to the founder





What We’re Looking For

- 5+ years in operations / delivery / team leadership

- Experience managing remote teams and shipping under pressure

- Strong execution mindset: you turn messy goals into clear plans and outcomes

- Comfortable holding people accountable and making hard calls

- Experience in ecommerce, performance marketing, or agencies is a big plus



Not a fit if you are:

- Fractional COO

- Consultant / advisor

- Looking for part-time hours





Compensation

USD 4,000 – 7,000 per month base (depending on experience) + performance bonus.





How to Apply

Apply via this Google Form (required):

title: Credit Repair Specialist/ Disputer
description:
About the Role



We are seeking an experienced Credit Repair Specialist Virtual Assistant to support our growing credit education and consulting business. This role requires hands on experience with credit disputes, compliance based processes, and client file management. This is not an entry level role.



The ideal candidate understands U.S. credit reporting systems, Fair Credit Reporting Act processes, and has direct experience working inside Credit Repair Cloud and submitting CFPB complaints.



Key Responsibilities



Process and manage credit dispute cases using Credit Repair Cloud



Submit and manage CFPB complaints for non response or violations



Review credit reports for inaccuracies, unverifiable items, and compliance issues



Track dispute timelines and follow up on responses



Maintain accurate client records and documentation



Communicate updates clearly to management



Follow strict compliance guidelines and internal SOPs



Assist with additional credit related administrative tasks as needed



Required Skills and Experience



Proven experience working in credit repair



Hands on experience with Credit Repair Cloud is REQUIRED



Experience submitting and managing CFPB complaints



Strong understanding of credit bureaus and dispute processes



Knowledge of Fair Credit Reporting Act basics



Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal



Strong attention to detail



Ability to follow instructions and meet deadlines



Professional and confidential handling of sensitive information



Reliable internet connection and computer



Preferred Qualifications



Experience working with U.S. based credit repair companies



Familiarity with dispute strategies and reinvestigation timelines



Experience reviewing Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion reports



Organized and able to manage multiple client files



Experience using CRM systems or client management tools



Ability to work independently with minimal supervision



Communication Requirements



Clear and professional written English



Ability to explain credit related tasks clearly



Responsive and reliable communication



Willing to provide status updates and ask questions when needed



Important Notes



This role does NOT involve sales



This role does NOT involve guaranteeing results



Strict compliance must be followed at all times



Training materials and SOPs will be provided, but prior experience is required



How to Apply



Please include:



A brief introduction



Your credit repair experience



Your experience with Credit Repair Cloud



Your experience submitting CFPB complaints



Any previous roles related to credit repair



Applications without relevant experience will not be considered.

title: VA - Ecommerce Operations, Financial Support & Customer Success Assistant
description:
Employment Type: Full-Time (Remote), FEMALE applicants only

Working Hours: 9am – 5pm AEST, Monday to Friday

Location: Philippines-based candidates preferred

Reports to: Head of Operations and Coaching



About SHE-com:

SHE-com is the world’s fastest growing community for female e-commerce brand owners. We are on a mission to empower women to launch, grow, and scale their online brands with confidence, clarity, and a lot of fun along the way. We simplify the complexities of online business with practical strategies, expert coaching, and a vibrant, supportive community.



Role Summary:

We're looking for someone truly special to join our team at SHE-com, Australia's fastest-growing community for female e-commerce founders.

This isn't just another VA role. This is about being the heartbeat of our member experience while empowering our founders with the financial clarity they need to make confident business decisions.

You'll be the bridge between our world-class coaches and our ambitious members, orchestrating seamless experiences across our digital ecosystem while helping founders understand their numbers and plan for sustainable growth. If you light up at the thought of making someone's day better, solving problems before they happen, translating financial data into actionable insights, and being the person everyone can count on, we want to meet you.



What You'll Own



Member & Coach Relationship Management:

- Nurture the relationship between our members and coaches across our Circle.so Hub, ensuring every interaction feels personal, timely, and supportive

- Be the first point of contact for member inquiries via phone and
, providing warm, professional, solution-focused support

- Proactively identify member needs and connect them with the right resources, coaches, or support before they even have to ask

- Monitor community engagement and flag opportunities to enhance member experience



Financial Operations & Founder Support:

- Help founders understand their numbers by supporting them with their KPI tracker - including fixing their spreadsheet if it has any technical errors.

- Help members understand their unit economics, cash flow, profitability, and key financial metrics based on their KPI tracker.

- Communicate financial information in a warm, non-intimidating way that empowers founders rather than overwhelms them

- Create a reporting solution to track individual members metrics over time.



Tech Stack & Operations Management:

- Master our core operational platforms: Slack, Circle.so, HubSpot, Google Workspace, and Excel/Google Sheets with precision and care

- Execute daily operational tasks following established SOPs while identifying opportunities to improve processes

- Maintain clean, organized systems that make life easier for both members and coaches

- Ensure all member touchpoints (onboarding, ongoing support, offboarding) are handled with exceptional attention to detail



Customer Journey Excellence:

- Think end-to-end about every member's experience, from their first interaction with SHE-com through their entire coaching journey

- Anticipate friction points in the customer journey and proactively implement solutions

- Track and optimize member satisfaction by ensuring timely responses, seamless access, and consistent communication

- Be forward-thinking in identifying ways to delight our members and exceed their expectations



Experience & Skills



Essential Experience:

- 10+ years of experience in e-commerce operations, client management, or virtual assistant roles (this is essential)

- Strong financial acumen with experience in bookkeeping, financial planning, or working with small business finances

- Excel/Google Sheets expert, you can build financial models, create formulas, design clear dashboards, and make complex data simple

- Small business financial context, you understand what matters in e-commerce: unit economics, cash flow, inventory management, profit margins, and the key metrics that drive sustainable growth

- Experience working with small businesses in a financial or operational capacity, you've seen what founders need to understand about their numbers

- Strong operational management background with a proven track record of following SOPs and maintaining systems

- Exceptional client management skills, you genuinely care about making people feel supported



Communication & Technical Skills:

- Outstanding ability to explain financial concepts to non-financial people, you make numbers feel approachable, not scary

- Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills

- Tech-savvy with experience managing CRMs, community platforms, and communication tools

- Comfortable speaking on the phone with members as a trusted point of contact



Personality & Approach:

- You have an eagle eye for detail, especially when it comes to numbers. Nothing slips through the cracks on your watch

- You're a natural relationship builder who understands that people, not just processes, are at the heart of great operations

- You're proactive and forward-thinking, you see around corners and solve problems before they become problems

- You have a gift for simplifying complexity, you can take a messy spreadsheet or confusing financial situation and make it crystal clear

- You genuinely light up when you help someone succeed, whether that's solving an operational issue or helping them finally understand their profit margins

- You're calm under pressure and can handle multiple priorities without losing your warm, supportive demeanour

- You're someone coaches and members alike feel they can trust with sensitive financial information



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But Amazing!):

- Formal qualifications in bookkeeping, accounting, or financial planning

- Experience with Xero, QuickBooks, or other accounting software

- Success coaching or client coaching experience

- Experience working in online education, coaching, or membership communities

- Familiarity with Circle.so, HubSpot, or similar platforms

- Deep understanding of the e-commerce industry and founder challenges



Minimum Role Requirements:

- 10+ years of experience in e-commerce operations, client management, or virtual assistant roles

- Demonstrated financial experience, bookkeeping, financial modeling, or working with small business finances

- Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills, you can build models, not just enter data

- Proven ability to manage tech stacks including CRM systems, community platforms, and communication tools

- Excellent phone and
 communication skills, you can build rapport instantly and explain complex information clearly

- High-speed internet suitable for video calls, file management, and platform access

- Must be available full-time, 9am – 5pm AEST, Monday to Friday



Why Join Us:

• Be part of an inspiring team of women who are passionate about changing lives

• Work in a flexible, remote-first environment with a schedule that fits your lifestyle

• Access to SHE-com’s programs and resources for your own growth

• Make a meaningful impact in the lives of hundreds of women entrepreneurs



How to Apply:



Submit Your Resume: Highlighting relevant experience.

Video Cover Letter (1-2 minutes):

- Why are you applying for this role at SHE-com?

- What about the company or position excites you?

- Why are you a great fit for this role?



 us your video and resume to 
 with the subject line: “Your New Finance VA!”

description:

title: Social Media Manager (Instagram & Reels)
description:

You should have a strong understanding of U.S. business culture, especially within the food, wellness, or lifestyle industry, and be comfortable executing social media strategies consistently and independently.



Position Details:

Location: Remote (Philippines-based only)

Work Hours: Must be available during Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours

Experience: Minimum 5 years in social media management or VA roles with social media focus

Start Date: ASAP

Compensation: Competitive, based on experience



Key Responsibilities:



Edit and post 3-5 Instagram/Facebook Stories daily using raw content provided via Google Drive



Build, edit, and publish 1 Instagram Reel per day (talking-head and short-form video)



Manage all Instagram DMs and respond professionally to new and existing followers



Perform daily engagement tasks: liking, replying, following, and unfollowing relevant accounts



Write captions aligned with our brand voice, campaign goals, and U.S. audience



Stay updated on Instagram/Facebook trends and suggest content ideas and improvements



Support all social media–related tasks as part of your virtual assistant responsibilities



Requirements:



Fluent in English with strong written and verbal communication skills



At least 5 years of experience as a Virtual Assistant and/or Social Media Manager



Proven experience editing videos, reels, and stories using tools such as Adobe, CapCut, InShot, or similar



Strong understanding of Instagram engagement strategies, DM etiquette, and community management



Experience working with U.S.-based businesses (food or lifestyle brands preferred)



Highly reliable, organized, and able to follow creative direction closely



Responsive and available during PST business hours



Stable internet connection and a professional, quiet workspace



Why Work With Us?



Long-term, stable VA role with clear expectations



Work directly with a creative founder and supportive team



Be part of a growing, mission-driven brand in the organic food space



Opportunity to contribute ideas while executing proven systems



Positive, respectful, and collaborative work environment



How to Apply:



If you’re a reliable Virtual Assistant with strong social media management skills, we’d love to hear from you.



Please submit:



Your resume with relevant VA and social media experience



Links to Instagram or TikTok accounts you’ve managed



A short written response (3–5 sentences) explaining why you’re a great fit for this role

title: Social Media Content Creator (9-5 Manila hrs, Australian team)
description:

In this role you will be asked to edit and colour grade professional videos and photos. We have a long-term, full-time position for someone who has the necessary technical skills, strong English, and will communicate with us on a daily basis to develop a good working relationship.



This is an advanced role for someone who is highly experienced with Lightroom, Photoshop, and Final Cut Pro (or similar).



Responsibilities:

- Professionally edit hiking, travel and outdoor photos using Lightroom and Photoshop

- Professionally produce travel and outdoor videos using Final Cut Pro (or similar)

- Create graphics for social media accounts and other marketing material

- Schedule content on social media accounts



Requirements:

- C1 or C2 English

- Reliable internet connection

- Extensive experience with Photoshop, Lightroom and Final Cut Pro (or similar)

- Colour grading experience for both photos and videos



What you get:

- Starting monthly salary of 1150 AUD based on experience (with an annual raise and potential bonuses)

- 9am - 5pm workday (Manila time)

- 13th month pay

- Paid sick leave

- 25 flexible days of paid time off (including holidays)

- Fortnightly pay

- We don’t expect or require you to use TimeProof



To apply, please attach your resume and submit a short video introduction about yourself (2-5 minutes) addressing the following points:



1. Start the video by saying 'Hello Maddie' - so we know it's not a generic video :)

2. A brief introduction about yourself.

3. What tools you like to use to edit photos and videos.

4. A specific example of a recent project you worked on - please highlight challenges faced and how you overcame them.

5. Your approach to prioritising tasks and staying organised in a dynamic work environment.



Please upload your video to a platform of your choice and share the link with us. Don't worry about production quality - content and clarity are what matter most.



When submitting an application, please use the subject line “[your name] + [your favourite ice cream flavour]” :)



If you are shortlisted for the job, you will proceed to an interview. We look forward to reviewing your application and are excited to work with you!

title: Accounts Recovery Assistant
description:
Employment Type: Part-time (Remote)

Location: Remote (Aligning to Australia AEDT hours)

Hours: 20 hours a week (Between 8 am and 4 pm, Monday to Friday)

Reports to: Head of Operations and Coaching

About SHE-com

SHE-com is the world’s fastest growing community for female e-commerce brand owners. We are on a mission to empower women to launch, grow, and scale their online brands with confidence, clarity, and a lot of fun along the way. We simplify the complexities of online business with practical strategies, expert coaching, and a vibrant, supportive community.

About the Role

We are looking for a proactive and friendly Accounts Recovery Specialist to join our team and support our community by helping members navigate failed payment issues. You will play a key role in maintaining positive relationships, supporting members through their payment challenges, and ensuring they continue to thrive in our programs. You will work closely under the guidance of our Product Lead to align with SHE-com’s goals and strategies.

As an Accounts Recovery Specialist, you will:

 • Monitor and manage all failed payments within the first 30 days, using HubSpot to stay on top of every detail

 • Make regular outbound phone calls to members to help them resolve payment issues quickly and positively

 • Handle difficult conversations with empathy and professionalism, balancing kindness with firmness to reach positive outcomes

 • Guide clients through payment problem-solving with compassion and confidence

 • Accurately document all call outcomes and next steps in HubSpot

 • Escalate any genuine hardship cases to your manager as per our process

 • Collaborate with our programs teams to ensure seamless transitions and member support

 • Track and report on key performance indicators like recovery rates, call volumes, and resolution times

 • Offer suggestions and feedback to improve the payment recovery process

 • Participate in ongoing training to stay up to date with best practices and SHE-com’s approach

About You

 • Passionate about supporting women in business and genuinely care about their success

 • Confident and warm on the phone, with experience handling high call volumes

 • Skilled at having hard conversations with empathy, understanding, and firmness, always aiming for a positive outcome

 • Organised and detail-oriented, with strong problem-solving skills

 • Comfortable using HubSpot CRM (training provided)

 • Analytical, able to review account histories and recommend solutions

 • Skilled at creating positive outcomes for both clients and the business

 • Adaptable and open to new technologies and process improvements

 • Experienced in phone-based customer service, credit control, or accounts

 • Familiar with subscription-based business models (preferred)

Why Join Us

 • Be part of an inspiring team of women who are passionate about changing lives

 • Work in a flexible, remote-first environment with a schedule that fits your lifestyle

 • Access to SHE-com’s programs and resources for your own growth

 • Make a meaningful impact in the lives of hundreds of women entrepreneurs

How to Apply:



Submit Your Resume: Highlighting relevant experience.

Video Cover Letter (1-2 minutes):

- Why are you applying for this role at SHE-com?

- What about the company or position excites you?

- Why are you a great fit for this role?



 us your video and resume to 
 with the subject line: “Your New Accounts Recovery VA!”

title: Order Management Lead - Remote Based
description:
APPLY HERE: 
/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pag8APoI3f6NCl7mv/form



Job Description



We're seeking a highly capable and proactive Operations Lead to join our dynamic team at HiEnd Accents. This role is critical in ensuring seamless order management and operational excellence across our organization. The ideal candidate will be a problem-solver with strong leadership skills and a track record of driving operational efficiency.



What You’ll Do



- Oversee and optimize the entire order management process, from intake to fulfillment, including:

   • Bringing in customer orders from various sources (portals, EDI,
s, faxes)

   • Confirming and making changes to orders in the ERP system

   • Releasing orders/backorders for shipping and organizing for easy picking

   • Creating delivery slips, invoicing shipped orders, and managing EDI documents

   • Uploading shipping and invoicing information to customer portals

- Lead and mentor the Order Management team, driving accountability and ensuring KPIs and SLAs are consistently met or exceeded.

- Manage key accounts with complex requirements, ensuring high customer satisfaction through:

   • Responding to inquiries with same-day service

   • Handling payment issues and order-related problems

   • Providing information on inventory availability and product inquiries

   • Phone outreach

- Proactively identify and resolve operational issues, developing and implementing solutions to prevent recurrence.

- Drive continuous improvement by:

   • Analyzing operational data to identify trends and opportunities

   • Collaborating cross-functionally to implement strategic changes

   • Contributing to special projects aimed at improving performance and scalability

- Spearhead process documentation (SOP) creation, encompassing both refinement of existing procedures and development of new ones.

- Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, vendors, and internal teams.

- Maintain accurate documentation of all actions, conversations, and issues using designated tools (e.g., Front and Airtable).

- Communicate effectively with the Warehouse team for shipment alignment.

- Perform other duties as assigned.



Who You Are



- A seasoned professional with 5+ years of experience in operations management, preferably in e-commerce or retail

- An experienced team manager

- Bachelor's degree in Business, Operations Management, or a related field

- Must have recent night shift (PH time) experience and be willing to report to work during CST hours

- Proven track record of contributing to team success and driving operational excellence

- Expert in order management systems, EDI, and inventory management

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights

- Excellent problem-solving skills with a solutions-oriented mindset

- Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities

- Proficient in the MS Office suite, with advanced Excel skills

- Experience with ERP systems and process automation tools

- Experience with SAP is not a requirement, but definitely a plus



Why HiEnd Accents?



Our small size and fast-paced culture reward people who act and think like owners. If you're someone who has a growth mentality, strives for exceptionalism, is a committed professional, and a straight shooter, you'll fit in with our culture and go far with our company.



About HiEnd Accents



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows, and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value. Our customers love our exceptional designs that span a diverse range of styles and our commitment to offering everyday luxury at accessible prices. We proudly serve a broad clientele, including department stores, furniture stores, boutique hotels, interior designers, and retail customers. HiEnd Accents is based in Irving, Texas. title: Paid Media Expert (Google Ads + LinkedIn Ads | B2B Tech Focus) Remote
description:
We’re looking for a talented, detail-oriented Paid Media Specialist with deep experience running Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and retargeting campaigns for B2B technology companies. You’ll play a key role in planning, executing, and optimizing paid campaigns that drive qualified leads, lower CAC, and support our clients’ growth goals.



This role is flexible and collaborative. We offer strategic support and guidance, and want you to feel valued as you deliver amazing work on our behalf.



Responsibilities:



Plan and manage paid media campaigns for our clients across Google Search, Display, YouTube, and LinkedIn Ads

Build and optimize retargeting campaigns to re-engage high-intent audiences

Analyze performance data and adjust campaigns based on KPIs (CPL, ROAS, CAC, etc.)

Provide regular performance reports with actionable insights

Conduct keyword research and develop audience targeting strategies based on B2B buyer intent

Collaborate with our team to align messaging, creative, and landing page strategy with campaign goals

Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in digital marketing and B2B tech

Meet deadlines consistently and communicate proactively about project status

Who We’re Looking For:



B2B Tech Experience: Proven experience running paid media campaigns for B2B technology companies is required

Portfolio Required: You must submit examples of previous paid campaigns — including ad copy, targeting strategy, and performance data (e.g., CPL, ROAS, CAC, etc.)



Detail-Oriented: You double-check everything — targeting, budgets, tracking, and reporting

Strong Communicator: You’re responsive, proactive, and clear in communicating performance, optimizations, and strategy

Google Ads + LinkedIn Ads Expertise: You have hands-on experience managing Google Search, Display, YouTube, and LinkedIn Ads campaigns

Retargeting Strategy: You know how to build and refine retargeting funnels to re-engage high-intent B2B audiences

Understanding of B2B Funnels: You can interpret lead generation data and align paid strategy to buyer intent and sales pipeline

Bonus: Experience setting up conversion tracking, integrating with HubSpot or other CRMs, or launching campaigns alongside content or
 marketing strategies

What We Offer:



An open, collaborative environment; We want you to enjoy working with us and support your professional growth

Strategic guidance and feedback (we don’t leave you guessing!)

Respect for your time and expertise

Pay Range:



Hourly rate or project-based pricing depending on your experience and working style

We’re committed to fair compensation and long-term collaboration with the right person

Hours:



5-15 hours per week, depending on project load and availability; ability to grow into other projects with more weekly hours

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a brief note about why you’re a great fit for this role, and a link to your portfolio or campaign samples that showcase your paid media work for B2B tech companies. Please also share any relevant performance metrics (such as CPL, ROAS, CAC, or engagement results) tied to your campaigns.



Application Question(s):



Do you have professional experience planning, executing, and optimizing paid media campaigns (Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and/or retargeting) specifically for B2B technology companies? (Please briefly describe the types of companies you’ve worked with and the goals you helped them achieve.)

Please share a link to your portfolio, case studies, or campaign samples that showcase your paid media work for B2B technology companies. (If available, please also include performance metrics — such as cost-per-lead (CPL), return on ad spend (ROAS), customer acquisition cost (CAC), or other relevant KPIs.)

Experience:



B2B tech marketing: 2 years (Required)

Google Ads: 2 years (Required)

LinkedIn Ads: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote





Please send your application, including your portfolio and previous advertising campaigns, to: 



Dan Connor 

Marketing Director at ATG (Auction Technology Group) 

London, England, United Kingdom

Paid Ads Management

 • Set up, manage, and optimize Meta 
 & Instagram) and Google Ads

 • Launch and test campaigns for multiple offers (services and training)

Tracking & Attribution (Critical)

 • Meta Pixel

 • Conversion API (CAPI)

Performance Monitoring & Reporting

Strategic Input

Requirements

title: Video Editor
description:
Looking for full time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be editing and making AI videos using AI tools like Veo3, Heygen, ElevenLabs, and Gemini. You will be generating B-roll video clips / AI characters talking and editing them in Capcut.



You will be trained extensively on how to do it, previous experience using CapCut is required, it's also preferred that you have past experience with HeyGen and Veo3 but not necessary. You'll be trained on how to generate Audio on elevenlabs, generate images/b rolls in Gemini/Veo3, using HeyGen to create talking AI avatars and editing through Capcut. It's quite easy once you get the hang of it, which we'll train you to do!



IMPORTANT: 



**If you have Veo3 and have experiences with generating B rolls and AI Characters speaking, please ONLY do this video: 



(If you don't have Veo3, ignore the video above and do the video BELOW)



Re-create this video using the following services and attach to your application:





1. Create an image similar to the one in the video attached above in Google Gemini (this is free)



2. Download the transcript from the video with this tool: www.submagic.co/tools/tiktok-transcript-generator



3. Create a free ElevenLabs account and run the script through ElevenLabs. Ensure the audio sounds realistic to the speaker's voice in the image you generated. Download the MP3.



4. Create a free HeyGen account. Using HeyGen, upload the MP3 as well as your image to generate the video.

Download the final file, add captions and text hooks just like in the viral video using Capcut and export.



Please attach these things in your application:

1. The google drive link to your Final recreate Assignment (Make sure the google link is PUBLIC)

2. Your Portfolio showing your Past work with Veo3/HeyGen if you have any.



If your Application does NOT have the Final Recreate assignment of the any of the video above, your application will be IGNORED.



Requirements for the job:



- Attention to detail

- Quick learner and improve through constructive feedback

- Prioritizes High-quality work over speed

- Strong critical thinking and independent problem-solving

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Availability for 6-8h a day (never more, sometimes less)

- Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever needed as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



You'll be on a Paid Trial once you're selected. Then you'll be required to work 20 Hours a Week on the Trial phase, 150$ per Month. 

When we think you fit the role, you'll be switched to Full time to work 40 Hours a week, 300$ per Month.

title: AR03 - Project Assistant (Construction)
description:
Job Summary

The Project Assistant provides administrative and technical support to the Project Manager and project team throughout the construction lifecycle. This role assists in coordinating project activities, maintaining documentation, tracking schedules and costs, and supporting communication between internal teams, consultants, and contractors to ensure projects are delivered on time and within scope.

Key Responsibilities

Project Coordination & Support

Assist the Project Manager in day-to-day project operations and coordination

Support planning, execution, monitoring, and close-out of construction projects

Track project schedules, milestones, and deliverables

Follow up on action items fro
etings and site activities

Documentation & Reporting

Maintain organized project files, drawings, specifications, contracts, RFIs, and submittals

Assist in preparing progress reports, meeting minutes, and project updates

Track change orders, variations, and approvals

Ensure documents comply with company and regulatory standards

Construction Process Support

Assist in reviewing construction drawings and basic specifications

Help coordinate with engineers, architects, contractors, and suppliers

Monitor material submittals, deliveries, and site requirements

Support quality control and safety documentation

Cost & Schedule Monitoring

Assist in tracking project budgets, purchase orders, and invoices

Help identify potential delays or cost overruns and report them to management

Communication & Coordination

Serve as a point of contact for internal and external stakeholders

Support clear communication between office and site teams

Qualifications & Requirements

Experience

1–3 years experience in construction, engineering, or project-based roles

Familiarity with construction processes, terminology, and project workflows

Technical Skills

Basic understanding of construction drawings and specifications

Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and project tracking tools

Experience with project management software (ClickUp) is an advantage

Soft Skills

Strong organizational and time management skills

Attention to detail and accuracy

Good written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

Preferred Skills (Optional)

Site experience or exposure to construction supervision

Knowledge of RFIs, submittals and subcon management

Ability to read and interpret basic construction plans

title: Supply chain manager
description:
We are looking for a detail-obsessed Supply Chain Manager who can fully own order fulfillment, supplier communication, stock control, and performance reporting for our fast-growing e-commerce operation.



This role is not theoretical. You will be measured daily on speed, accuracy, and execution. If you need hand-holding or hate KPIs, don’t apply.



???? Your Mission



Ensure that every product is sourced, shipped, and delivered on time, with zero surprises. You are responsible for stock availability, fulfillment speed, quality control, and supplier accountability, while reporting clear KPIs directly to the CEO.





???? Responsibilities

Track all orders from purchase to dispatch

Ensure suppliers ship within 2 business days

Follow up immediately on delays and manage refunds when required

Monitor deliveries to ensure arrival within 10 working days

Maintain an on-time delivery rate of 90%+

Verify stock levels for all actively advertised products

Perform quality checks on products with 5+ sales

Calculate BEROAS weekly for all active products
